Reviews.Title: “Not well received”
Reviews.Author: AJgigi
Reviews.Content: Having booked on the internet I got a good price compared Toronto standards. But when I arrived at the hotel I learned that the rooms advertised in the photos were those which were recently remodelled, while my booking were with a room that is not remodelled.(unacceptable) . I begrudgingly accepted the upgraded room for the rest of my days, even the upgrade fees of course. Despite the extra upgrade fee, the room turned out to be small, noisy and essentially no privacy as the window was placed in front of the window in another room. The reception staff is cold and not very helpful, particularly one discourteous+obnoxious young fellow. The location is central, but the general feeling is disappointing and tends to dull the senses. I don't recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but lacking the "little things" of a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: abe416
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 1 night for business. It's a great location right across from the train station where I arrived. I had a bad first experience with the staff and I found them pretty rude. I think they were very rushed and seemed really busy and provided me with very curt responses to my questions. When I called the front desk to ask for the wi-fi password nobody picked up the first time. The second time, I was put on hold. When I finally spoke with someone, they were again very short with me and not friendly. Made me feel like I was inconveniencing them. When I visited the front desk to ask for express checkout, the same thing happened, I was told yes they would take care of it and was brushed off. I never received my bill in my room as I was told I would. This hotel seems bad at the "little things" that make great hotels really stand out. The elevators actually seemed fine to me. But I never felt truly comfortable in the hotel. I had a laundry list of things that rubbed me the wrong way, so I walk away feeling not great. I'd say you can find better hotels in the area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hansiman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Room was rather small, but clean. Walls are thin and thus it's somewhat noisy at night. I had a room at the back of the hotel and the inlet of my aircon was situated above the outlet of the steakhouse underneath/next to the hotel. So, my rooms smelled nice like BBQ-ribs in the evenings.... Fortunately after 10 PM when the kitchen was closed the smell was gone almost immediately. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast (buffet) was okay (for $16). Only one elevator worked, which caused some waiting when using the elevator. The hotel is very central located and a great place to start a couple of days visiting Toronto. If you're visiting Toronto and looking for a reasonable priced hotel, this might be it.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location”
Reviews.Author: tshep42
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty small, but had all the basics: hair dryer, TV, iron and ironing board, desk, etc. We were in town for a Leafs game and we were a 5-10 minute walk to the Air Canada Centre. One elevator was broken while we were there. The staff were helpful. We arrived late, with only a few minutes to get to the hockey game, and the staff were great in taking our luggage and sending us off. There is a Tim Horton's right across the street. Union Station is a few minutes walk. And, the shuttle to Toronto City Airport comes right across the street at the Fairmont Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: lotto649
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel when i have visited Toronto to write my nursing exam . It was great location just couple of minutes walking distance from union station and close to convention center where i have written my exam. on the plus side rooms are clean, front desk are friendly and location. on the negative side rooms are bit small and only one elevator was working during the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from location, not much to recommend...”
Reviews.Author: WarsawWanderer
Reviews.Content: Trying to be positive, I'd say this hotel's location (near Union Stn, Royal York Hotel, Financial District) is good. Other than that, not much to recommend: 1 elevator of 2 was out of order (another guest told me it had been for a year...), the furnishings were basic, the room was not perfectly clean, the heater was an old-fashioned clunker, hard to use. The price, tho lower than most in that district (CAD 135 single, pre-paid), should have been lower.

Reviews.Title: “Shelled out way too much, for way too little.”
Reviews.Author: dap1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an atypically sized room recently refurbished with typical IKEA-esque decor. It's simply mundane and ineffective. There was barely enough room for luggage. Papier mached walls also made for a ghastly night's sleep. Chilly doleful reception, noisy halls, no free internet, no parking, no gym, unreliable elevators. The cost for the room was high compared to similar hotels in the area which likely service the guest completely. For a few dollars more, shop around before settling for uncharming and insufficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne G
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfectly located, walking distance to restaurants and close by all needed in Toronto. Very small clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Updates missed the mark”
Reviews.Author: oc3anz
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona Hotel has been getting a makeover, but it misses the mark with some decisions. In my "deluxe" double room, the one closet had about 6 inches of space in which to hang items, which I had to squeeze past the ironing board and television both of which now live there. There is nowhere to hang a hand-towel, and the shutters (not curtains) were in two sections - the highest of which were too high for me to close without standing on the bed. There are signs for conservation all over the room, but the linens were washed anyway and there is no recycling bin for paper or cans etc. Plus, there is still a cost for wireless internet access (in a "business" hotel?!?) and only one elevator was working - so slowly I had to take the stairs each morning, which emptied into a back alley. I don't think I'll stay there again, even though the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: AidanRyanJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to the Maple Leafs game and decided to make it a night out away from the kids. We booked the Strathcona Hotel online even though we never heard of this hotel before. The rate fit in our budget much more than the Royal York Hotel. We couldn't have asked for a better location. It's about a 5-minute walk from Union Station and the Air Canada Centre. We had a few drinks in the bar in the basement of the hotel before the game and had a bite to eat. The pub was very busy but the service was okay. The rooms in the hotel are small but very well-appointed and clean. I liked the hardwood floors in the rooms, it made it seem a lot cleaner. Ask for the upgraded room. We had a king-sized bed and it was very comfortable. Makes us want to buy one for home. In the morning, we grabbed our TImmies from right across the street, walked over to Union Station and headed home. Couldn't have asked for a better night. The Leafs won, we had a great night out and a great sleep. My only complaint was there was only one elevator working. We had to wait a bit for the elevator in the morning but the person at the front desk apologized and said they were changing the elevators and it would be done in a few weeks. The people at the front desk were very polite. We would definitely returne to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Excellent Staff & Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Madison S
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto last weekend for a trade show and I cannot say enough about how amazing this hotel was. It was my first stay here. From my check in with Brendan which was seamless in execution, to my delicious 5 star lunch at York Street Cafe in between my sessions - was a welcome treat. The Executive Chef Tony happened to walk by my table during a very busy lunch and ask how everything with my meal was which was an incredibly touching and memorable treat. The fact that the Chef would take the time to ask, WOW. After a long day of sessions I preferred to stay close to the hotel on the second night and the Pub located in the hotel was gorgeous - fireplaces, comfortable and stylish couches make it cozy enough for me to put up my feet, read my book and have a glass of wine. The Strathcona is the perfect location whether you need to be near the theatre district, restaurant district or financial district - located in the downtown core you are at the heart of everything. My room was comfortable and stylish and the bed super comfy and more importantly, spotless! I had a wonderful time at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who isnt sure where they should stay in Toronto. Did I mention the incredible rate? Definitely the best value for my money...STAY HERE IF YOU WANT A FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE IN TORONTO!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel's for chicks.....cheap cheap cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Gravedigginchick
Reviews.Content: My husband and me came for the Monster truck show at Rogers Center on Jan. It was super fun. What the hotel lacks in amenities and services they make up for it by being centralized. Near to the night-club scene, sports arenas; Rogers Center/Air Canada Center. Restaurants, theater, shopping, and best of all, being cheap cheap cheap. Did I mention cheap? The weekend was fun and exciting. Thanks Gravedigger for tarin' the place up!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location -not much else....”
Reviews.Author: Rbjdtb
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to Toronto for my 40th and after much deliberation we stayed here. Reviews between here and the Delta seemed fairly even, but maybe we should have gone for the Delta. We booked an Executive room via Expedia and then my partner e-mailed the hotel to say it was a special trip and did they have anything to make it more special - we got a very short and quick reply - there wasn't anything extra they could offer. Very strange for a hotel these days. Even without any upgrade surely a bit of customer service would have been to put some fruit in the room or give us a voucher for a drink at the pub? But nothing. Then the room, tiny, not sure where "Executive" comes into it??? They put us on the 8th floor with a lovely view of the alley and rooms opposite, and naked old men watching TV on their beds, they just knew how to make it special for me lol! Then the elevator - only one working, the other closed for maintenance for the whole 6 days we were there, we did try the stairs (yes from the 8th floor) but ended up in a very dark alley after climbing down stairs that had broken beds on them. So decided to wait for the elevator from then on. Housekeeping, not friendly, even though we tipped every day, but she did give us some extra coffee. Staff only speak when you do, no "good mornings" or polite smiles. Reception was ok when we checked out, kept our bags for a couple of hours, concierge was ok when we booked a Niagara tour through him but never acknowledged again. We loved Toronto and its people, maybe because they are all so friendly it makes the Strathcona feel cold and lacking. We will be back soon but won't be staying here. There is lots of choice in Toronto and we look forward to finding the warmer welcomes we know are out there in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: AG1968
Reviews.Content: I came into Toronto for a few interviews and meetings. I traveled alone this time. The hotel is located just steps to the Exchange Tower where most of my meetings were held. It was literally five minutes away, walking. This was very convenient. I flew in on Porter Airlines. They land on the city's island airport. There is a shuttle that picks up and drops off just steps from the hotel. It takes about fifteen minutes each way. The room was congested, not much of a view. I guess, technically, facing a wall is a view. The room was adequately serviced daily. Their pub serves up, not so tasty, frozen to pan/oven fare. There are better options to eat just minutes from the hotel. The check out was interesting. It was fine, although being asked if I could comment about my stay on Tripadvisor was rather uncouth. The whole stay was just fine, except for the desperate attempt for validation for a job done at the end was a bit daunting and classless. I hope management isn't coercing their staff to do this. The hotel did what it is expected, to provide customary service to its paying guests. This is what I expect in exchange for my hard earned dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: AverageJill3
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights through hotels.ca in January 2012 at a rate of $89/nt not including taxes or fees. The hotel is well situated, less than a 5 minute walk from both St. Andrew's and Union subway station as well as many dining/cafe options. The staff were friendly and prompt at both check-in and check-out and were more than happy to hold our bags after check-out. We did not try the on-site cafe or pub. What makes this hotel poor value are the rooms. We booked a "smart Queen", which ended up being a tiny outdated room with a tiny outdated bathroom. The windows were oddly placed high up with an ugly view of a roof below and had shutters/slats as opposed to curtains. Climate control was lacking so the room was either freezing or too hot and stuffy. The walls were very thin so we were kept awake by idling trucks outside on the street as well as patrons/staff slamming doors and talking outside. The blankets were thin and felt (?) polyester, the cups were flimsy plastic and the generic soap/shampoo came out of awkward squeeze bottles mounted on the wall. The internet was not complimentary and costed $6.00 per day or $10.00 for 3 days. Overall, not the most restful or satisfying experience. Ended up getting much better value through one of the bidding sites for the following night in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Short business trip to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: geniesserincosmopolite
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ok for one person. The staff is really friendly and made me feel comfortable. All of them I met were very obliging. The hotel is well located next to the Union Station and the CN Tower. At plus the lake is not fare away. For me it was perfect too, that the amazing underground shopping world is on the other side of the street. The service was ok. I haven't had the breakfast, but it looked intresting, with a great choise of everything. I would recommend this hotel to someone who needs not the biggest room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvonnesellen
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona Hotel in Toronto is an excellent hotel with good prices, convenient location and clean, comfortable rooms and right across the street from a Tim Hortons.

Reviews.Title: “Word to the wise”
Reviews.Author: Dunnvillygirl
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto for a one night's sleep. I was traveling on VIA Rail next morning. The hotel is very well situated to Union Station ( VIA Rail ). Approximately 5 minutes walking. I arrived late and met with a lewd agent. I don't mind pleasant banter, except personnel should not attempt to fraternize with its guests. It's inappropriate, it delivers the wrong kind of message and impairs the image of the establishment. My room was fine, a bit on the claustrophobic side but It was just for short rest before taking the morning train out. I did like this hotel for its location and the value. The only thing is, first impressions last a lifetime. From all the other reviews I've read about this hotel I really hope this was a one time inappropriate experience. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: BB1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in September 2011. We managed to get a good rate on our stay which was great as Toronto seems to be an expensive city to visit. Service at the hotel was good. Nothing special but we didn't have any major issues. The rooms were small but clean and comfortable. We stayed during the opening weekend of the Toronto International Film Festival and were only a 5-10 minute walk from the centre of all the action. There was also a subway for the local line close by and only a 5 minute walk to Union Station. Easy walk to the CN tower and Rogers Centre too. Breakfast was available for purchase but was quite expensive, however there is a Tim Hortons just across the road. Also the bar beneath the hotel does a great feed with reasonably priced drinks. There was also many other great restaurants within a 10 minute radius. Overall I have no hesitations in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quaint”
Reviews.Author: LizieB
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Canada. I traveled with a friend of mine. We booked our whole trip through a travel firm a little while ago. Our stay in the Strathcona Hotel was a pleasant one. The room was rather small but suitable enough for our needs. The entire hotel crew were terrific. The rate was reasonable and the hotel's location is right in the heart of downtown Toronto. We were able to walk around with no trouble at all. There is a nice British-style pub located in the lowermost level of the hotel. There is a modest charge for wi-fi. The breakfast-room is located in the hotel's lobby. The breakfast buffet was an full array of delicious foods to choose from. There wasn't any exercise area or a pool within the hotel, which was a bit disappointing. The personalized concierge service was excellent-Our concierge ably sorted out our whole stay with his expert suggestions of things to do and places to visit in Toronto. We mentioned to him that we were taking a trip to New York City after our Toronto stay. He thoughtfully compiled a compilation of important things to see and do for our New York trip..Thanks to his recommendations, we enjoyably toured Toronto, and New York City, with the mightiest of confidence and with the easiest of ease.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but cold - great location for train station”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after catching the train from Vancouver and before catching a train to New York the next day. So location was critical and the Strathcona was a perfect choice. The rooms were comfortable, although cold - we were though able to turn on an in room heater. The staff were friendly and the room was clean and so for a reasonable price the choice was a good one. An easy walk to shops, restaurants etc. They also were able to let us check in at 10am - so a good start!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Wilkey77
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay in a hotel that I've ever experienced. Customer service was horrendous. We were charged almost $200 for a coffin sized room. The pictures on the website are very deceiving. We didn't get the wake-up call that we had called down for. With all the noise in the hallway, we hardly slept a wink. The front desk agent in morning gave us a heedless apology for the inconveniences. This was January the 1st and check-out was an ordeal. There was only one agent on hand working? We were already late for our flight and this just added to the misery. This was a terrible start to our new year. Thank you kindly Strathcona hotel for your way less than hospitable services. No frills and no class should be this hotel's motto.

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal J
Reviews.Content: We went for new years and they managed the holiday well. Classy place, clean fair sized rooms, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly average”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonBigSteel
Reviews.Content: We came into Toronto for a hockey game. "GO LEAFS GO!!!!"....NOT!! Upon check in, the agent was a bit short with us, it seemed as though we were an inconvenience. None the less, we were not going to let the boorish attitude spoil our trip. The room was dark and cramped, but with gorgeous views of the alley with a hint of mildew in the air. Still, the price was right, we didn't mind, we were just going to stay the night. We made our way down to the bar, or should I say dungeon. It was lifeless and gloomy, so we escaped and made our way down to Casey's. The hotel is very close to Union Station/GO Station, which is a plus. The ACC (Air Canada Center) is about a 5 min walk from the hotel, which more of a plus. Breakfast was average, but service was great, the waitress was very sweet. In a nutshell, if you're looking for cheap average accommodations,conveniently close to Union Station and the ACC, this is definitely the spot. It would be advisable for management to pay close attention to reception, it may be due for some attitude adjustments.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, very clean but cramped”
Reviews.Author: flandaz
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay again at Strathcona as I enjoyed our stay last year. Location of the hotel is great, no complaints there. The rooms are very clean and modern, beds comfy. The views from the room aren't great, but it is downtown Toronto. Our room this time was very small. Room for your cases, but not much room to move. There are also no glasses, just paper and plastic cups. No fridge, but ice vending machine down the hall. The shower is nice, big shower head, ok pressure. I seem to remember an iPod dock in our last room, not one here. They were advertising upgraded rooms on a sign at the desk, maybe those are now the larger suites. The desk service is ok, I've had rude service twice there, but it's not consistently bad. I stay there if I just care about cleanliness and location. If you get a good price go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to convention centre”
Reviews.Author: DrivingSoul
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Strathcona Hotel for a quick overnight for an early morning meeting at th Convention Centre. The room was very small but clean and suitable for a business stay. I wouldn't recommend the small queen room if you are looking for a romantic stay. Parking in the green metro parking lot next door is a bit problematic as there is no direct hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lee W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for about 2 weeks and have no complaints, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a double and have more than enough space for the both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but lots to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: SeeCanada
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beaten, and it's great to have an affordable option so close to Union Station and lots else. I quite enjoyed the fact that my admittedly small room had some character, unlike the same-everywhere chains. Pros: Very clean, comfortable bed, all the things I needed. Cons: Chilly and the coffee-maker didn't work!

Reviews.Title: “|Another good place to stay in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SueBee62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights last month and I was pleased with the experience. The room was spacious, bright and clean. It was very close to the Convention Center where I was taking part in a trade show. I had originally booked an econo room but once there I realized it was too small. The staff were quick to remedy the situation and I was shown to a larger room immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: ando243
Reviews.Content: Arrived here via the airport express bus ($20 one way) and got dropped off at a stop right across the street from the hotel. Checked in insanely early which proved no problem and the staff encountered were polite and helpful. The hotel is centrally located, a 5 minute walk to the hockey hall of fame and 10minutes to the CN Tower and City Hall. The room (703) was reasonably small but was equipped with a comfortable bed, great central heating system and a modern bathroom - all being spotlessly clean. The only negative that I can mention was that there was some street noise , but I still managed to get a good nights sleep. WiFi wasn't included in the rate but at $6 for 24hrs wasn't too bad and was reasonably fast. There's also a restaurant/bar in the basement with a pretty good selection of beers etc as well - a good place to start off a night out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Sports Day, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cara444
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Toronto to see my beloved Redskins play the Bills in the Bills Toronto Series. After tailgating and the debacle of a game, we went to The Real Sports Bar to simultaneously watch my husband's Dallas Cowboys lose to the Eagles (yay!) and Toronto lose to the Sens in OT (boo!). Other than the terrible sports results, we had a great trip. We stayed at the Strathcona Hotel. We requested an early check in and a late check out both of which they were able to accommodate even though they had been busy the night before our check in. The room was small, but very space efficient and had everything we needed. The location was great, walking distance to the stadium and to the Sports Bar afterwards. The beds were super comfortable and we had a great nights sleep. Thank goodness for that late check out! We had lunch at a local restaurant before heading out of the city, it was a fun and memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Compact rooms but modern and clean. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: born_t0_travel
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to sites, restaurants, subways. Tight room, but modern, clean and nicely furnished. Free WiFi is available in the lobby. The cost of internet is way too high at about $20 per day. You are probably better off going to a Starbucks. The restaurant in the hotel is pricey and only mediocre. Staff was helpful, friendly and accommodating. I would stay here again for the well-maintained rooms and convenient location, but that is really it. Not much amenities here.

Reviews.Title: “room is small and elevator is very noisy”
Reviews.Author: KrisDhiradityakul
Reviews.Content: Quite clean and staff are helpful. However, the room is very small - feel uncomfortable and elevator was very noisy. The hotel has just been renovated - not that great but ok. If you don't have any other better choice for the same price, then it is ok for a few nights

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Graham_Bailey
Reviews.Content: On arriving at 12.00pm we were extremely pleased to to be told our room was ready and we were able to check in. The reception staff were very helpful & offered us an upgrade (at an additional small cost) if our room was not acceptable. However, as the room was more than adequate, we were happy to accept it. The room was very clean & provided good value for money. Throughout our stay (10 nights) we received good customer service & excellent housekeeping. The location of the hotel was second to none & our whole stay was made that much nicer, as a result of staying at the Strathcona.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: millyc28
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the strathcona. Very centrally located in downtown and reasonably priced for where it is. I booked on last minute.com for the half term holidays and was still pleased with the price. Friendly and accommodating staff. Comfortable room with coffee maker, hair dryer, ipod dock, t.v, heater and very comfortable bed. It is one of the few hotels that the airport express bus stops at. (cheaper option if you're a lone traveller). It stops at the Fairmont Royal York and the Strathcona is across the road. Tim Hortons is across the road from the hotel where you can grab breakfast, coffee, etc at very good prices and quite yummy too! So if you don't have breakfast included in your rate go to Tim's instead of paying apparently $18 at the hotel. Important stuff if you've got early starts and busy days. Generally a great stay with local amenities within walking distance. Safe at night too!!

Reviews.Title: “Jury's out”
Reviews.Author: redsox367
Reviews.Content: Really can't decide. Pro's Very Clean Great location Good atmosphere Staff generally friendly, though checkin was a bit indifferrent Con'sl Drab looking exterior which does nothing for the hotel image and does not match what you find inside Room smaller than expected, despite selecting a room above the basic specification Laughable storage, a closet which was less than 2 feet wide and a small chest of drawers that everytime I tried to open I had to put my foot against otherwise to stop it sliding across the floor. The rooms at the front are affected by noisy traffic expecially around rush hour, be warned if you are a light sleeper Overall I probably would go back but have a nagging doubt that because I was travelling on my own I was given deliberately given a small room

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very deceiving!!!”
Reviews.Author: Turlu
Reviews.Content: The rooms are outdated, very small, no parking availabile, check-in was very average, and the wireless was not working properly....enough said !!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room - Unbeatable Location & Price!”
Reviews.Author: CharOliver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strathcona because of the location and the amazing price. I wasn't expecting much, but I was definitely impressed right from a quick and efficient check in to checking out. I have nothing but great things to say about my stay. The room was clean and modern. NO CARPET! I love that... I travel frequently for work and usually the carpets in hotel rooms are the stuff of nightmares so this was refreshing to see. While the room wasn't gigantic, there was more than enough room to get a bit of work done at the desk and watch some TV on the flat screen. I love that the hotel was walking distance to Union Station and the underground path. There is a Tim Hortons directly across the street and tons of fantastic restaurants and attractions within walking distance. I had such an amazing experience that I would definitely return and recommend to all my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: Paquerette y
Reviews.Content: Did not expect much from the outside but incredible from the inside. Have never met nicer and helpfull staff. Especially the front desk, Brendan has been very professional to give recommendation about things to do and make us feel home! The executive plus rooms, bed and tv, the bar downstairs with a fireplace were all phenomenal.... A perfect location, downtown, close to all main tourist attractions and clubs. All what was missing is a bit more of sun! Can recommend this hotel very highly, lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gaudzrn
Reviews.Content: Let me first admit that I frequently use Hotwire and priceline when booking my hotels when i come to the city. On this occasion, my wife and I had tickets to 2 Leafs games, thus we needed accomodations for 3 nights. For some reason, I couldn't get a significant discount for all 3 nights on either site. On the advice of a friend, I contacted the Strathcona to inquire about rates. I ended up speaking with a Manager named Brendan who was able to answer all my questions regarding the hotel. I ended up booking 2 rooms for myself and a couple of friends of mine that were joining us on the trip for a very reasonable rate. I knew that the hotel didn't have their own parking garage, but being somewhat comfortable in the city, I knew of many parking garages in the area. I ended up finding one within a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Having never been in the hotel, I was quickly relieved to see a very clean and modern Lobby, and check in was a breeze thanks to the very friendly staff on hand. Regarding the staff at the desk, I had to call on them twice during our stay when my wife and i had issues with our card, and they were always super friendly and very helpful. The room we had was on the 11th floor (1117) and it was very clean , and nicely decorated. Sure the rooms are on the small side, but we basically just needed somewhere to hang our hat and sleep. The beds are very comfortable, and although small, the bathrooms were nice and modern. There is a pub located in the basement, which is very cozy, and has great food. The gentleman serving us on both nights was very friendly, and the drinks were very much enjoyed. The best thing about the Strathcona is the location. We were across the street from Union Station, which pretty much gives you access to the whole city. Seeing as though we were there for 2 hockey games, we were a 5 minute walk to the ACC and Rogers Centre/CN tower. There is also many many great restaurants and pubs in the area. The location is the best! If I had to list some negatives, I would have to say that due to it's location, and shape, many rooms have no view. For some that might be an issue, but as mentioned, I was there to explore the city, not sit in my room and look out the window. Also, I found the wi-fi to be a little on the slow side. Not sure why. lastly, there is only ice and vending machines on 1 floor (3rd). This was kind of an inconvienience when i woke up very "dry" after celebrating the leafs victory over the Habs. :-) When planning my next trip to T.O, I will be sure to call on the Strathcona first because of their location, value and service from their staff. I was very very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluehova
Reviews.Content: I visited Toronto for vacation and stayed at the Strathcona Hotel which I found to be a good choice. At first, I was a bit skeptical because of some of the bad reviews that were posted but I say to anyone to ignore the bad reviews. This hotel was very pleasant. I stayed on the 7th floor, the front desk staff was polite and even the concierge was polite and very knowledgeable about the city and things to do. This Hotel is right in the downtown area which is an ideal location for anyone. It was within walking distance to just about everything. The subways, shops, Eaton Centre mall, CN Tower, Rogers Stadium and the list goes on. I'm not kidding, I walked to a lot of the downtown attractions from this hotel and if it was a bit too far, I caught the subway to yonge street or say the royal ontario musuem. My room was clean. House keeping came in everyday and tidy up the place and replace my coffee every-time at no charge. The floors were also quiet. Some people wrote reviews that this hotel is noisy but they probably had a rare occasion of college students next door or something. My point is that this hotel was a bang for my buck. Location, friendly staff, cleaniness, etc. I will definitely stay there again when I come back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & value”
Reviews.Author: MojoLad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Toronto to visit friends and needed a place to stay near the train station. The Strathcona had the best rates by far -- about a third less than everybody else! -- and their very central location was terrific. Our room was modern, clean, remarkably quiet, and the front desk staff were helpful in selecting a dinner spot; in fact, chatting up a Toronto policeman outside, his restaurant opinions happened to match theirs almost exactly! The only negatives, and they were modest, were the air conditioner in the room (slightly noisy, and quite necessary during the hot & humid night) and the fact that the hotel has no parking --- though there is an immense underground lot, adjacent. If you didn't rent a car, the Airport Express Shuttle Bus from Pearson stops right across the road, and everything you can imagine is within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised! Affordable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DeniseMcDon
Reviews.Content: I had a colleage stay at the Strathcona a few months back and she had nothing but great things to say so I thought I'd give them a try as well. The room rates are compariable to most hotels but the location is fabulous. You're in the heart of the city with every convenience you can imagine. It is a boutique hotel so the rooms are not the largest but very clean and stylist. A nice surprise! The staff were pleasant and always quick to say hello. I even ventured into (or rather discovered) the pub downstairs. It's a quiet, low lit place. Nothing special about the menu or what they have on tap but still a nice hangout. I would reco this place to anyone staying in TO on business - it's a step above.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean, comfortable and good value!”
Reviews.Author: fjmtravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Strathcona on our last few visits to Toronto. We have found the rooms to be very comfortable, clean and well appointed.Staff are always very friendly and helpful and they always have time to help us find a good restaurant or pub. The Strathcona is very conveniently located to the theatre district and is close to everything we want to see! Even though parking is offsite, access to the hotel from the street is convenient and trouble free. After years of visiting Toronto for both personal and business reasons, I have to say that the value at the Strathcona cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: leafsrule
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times over the past 4 years. The location is the best you can find for downtown Toronto. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. The rooms were very clean. I will stay their again, and recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Good location + friendly staff = perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Anton G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for several reasons. First of all, it very (and i mean very!) inexpensive for its location. Its basically close to the most touristically attractive places in the Downtown Toronto. Secondly, the staff that we have dealt with was professional and friendly, which seems to be a fairly rare thing in the GTA. Finally, even though the rooms were not as big as expected, the lack of space was made up for by the neatness of them. It might not be the best hotel, if you are planing to stay in the Downtown and watch TV...but if you are here to see what Toronto has to offer, its an awesome place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location but watch what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: travelingal12
Reviews.Content: Small clean room and very centrally located to CN Tower, Air Canada Centre and subway. It doesn't have it's own parking lot but one was close by. The room had a view of a brick wall and the toilet seat had no cover so naturally something fell in. My biggest issue was that is was advertised as "the deal of the day" on Expedia for $120/night but by 10am that was gone and we ended up paying $280/night. Then when I phoned the hotel I could get a 2 twins for $165/night but by then could not cancel the reservation I had made. Now I am constantly be spammed by advertisements on my computer for the Strathcona to get lowest rate! I find that insulting ..like ha, ha..look what we got you to pay! It certainly is a centrally located hotel and I found it to be clean but with no amenities which I was not interested in, anyway as I was there to be downtown. It would have gotten a better rating if only I hadn't paid so much. NOT good value for the money but generally a nice hotel none-the-less.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: misterwiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, the personnel friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the small side, but very European style and manageable. We were there for 10 nights and managed quite well. Downtown location, close to train station, restaurants, and a short walk to the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: sassyleslie1121
Reviews.Content: I had a friend coming in from out of town and they wanted to see downtown Toronto, since I live a little bit outside of the city I thought we would get a hotel and stay closer to the tourist stuff. The Strathcona website is very pretty and makes the rooms look great....when we checked in we got a room that had 2 twin beds and literally that's all you can fit inthe room had an old 13" tv that was all full of static and it was just terrible not to mention there was a bug in the room that needed killing!! The room was so tiny it was a complete rip off for the price they asked for I would not recommend this hotel at all. The rooms are paper thin we could hear the alarm clock in the next room going off and the toilet flush not good at all oh and not to mention they charge $10 bucks a day for internet in the room or you can pay $3 bucks for 10 MINS in the business centre no thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle J
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small the service was amazing. Staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was modern and extremely clean. Everyone was nice (bartender at the pub downstairs was offering custom items not on the menu to people, staff let me check in hours early at no cost, concierge spent time going over all of the different restaurants, friendly housekeepers, etc) It is right across from the Royal York hotel. I had the executive suite for much less that the cheapest room at the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Met with extremely rude front desk person during check-in”
Reviews.Author: luvtomovetosouthwest
Reviews.Content: We booked and when I arrived at check in (since my friend was joining me later), it was just before 2PM. I had called the night before and confirmed the room we had booked with a credit card guarantee. When I checked in, she would not honor the reservation with the credit card guarantee and she was going to downgrade that reservation. When I told her that I had confirmation for this specific room she was not too pleased and said "well we are overbooked" That is not our problem, and given that I called the night before, there should be a room. And finally she angrily replies "I will have to move someone else" as if this was all too inconvenient for her. There was always a room available obviously and these inconsistent replies about room (un) availability was really uncalled for. The room itself was very nice. And indeed we brought the matter to the manager and her action was appreciated. The server at the restaurant was great and very warm and gracious. The only thing that would prevent us from returning is if we were met with that disgustingly rude front desk person again. Who wants to start off their stay with that kind of treatment....

Reviews.Title: “Beside the great location, its not worth staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clientavertis
Reviews.Content: - great location to visit and business trip but that all - no underground parking and valet service available: beware 28$\night parking and no street parking available near by - workung in the industry, any respectable hotel should offert upgrade or a personnal human service to new guests - as well, probably because we booked through hotel.com on our Iphone they did not care and gave us a very compacted and too small room. Bad jugement... - hotel is clean, saw all the time cleaning crew polishing through out the commun areas - our bathroom fan did not work, our window faced the hotel rooms in front of us... Always had to have our blinds closed.... Could not open any windows... - too compact and too small room... Not fonctionnal at all, even for a business trip I would not stay there. - reception staff very nice, polite, friendly and helpfull - very disappointed... Price/quality not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Gem is not the word”
Reviews.Author: amtrak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (meaning my family - 3 boys and hubby) and it was very comfortable. The room was bigger than I expected - especially that you r in the city - the room was very comfortable - it was an executive room 2 double beds - it was very clean - no carpet just wood floors which is a plus a nice closet and a great flat screen tv - the location was very close to rogers centre which is our main purpose of being there - but also close to st lawrence market and other famous toronto places - very pleased - located right across from a Tim Horton which is good for breakfast and parking was two blocks away for 18.00 a day - it was perfect!!! Would stay here again if I came back to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “My choice hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: Gerald C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little small compared to other hotels; but the cleanliness, service, and location in the downtown core is excellent. Great value for the price considering walking distance to most toronto attractions including Air Canada Center, Skydome, CN Tower, and theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Was good”
Reviews.Author: Tristan J S
Reviews.Content: Well air conditioned room, modern look. Very comfy bed. Plenty of variety for breakfast. Expensive phone calls are kind of ridiculous, but overall enjoyful.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: avari82
Reviews.Content: The bed was only a few feet away from the bathroom and since the bathroom had no fan this posed a bit of a problem. The room was extremely small for the price we paid though the location was good for major commercial shopping areas and events. No good for night life though, please note that the hotel pub is not open on Sundays. The staff gave us a less than warm welcome upon arrival, the fire alarm went off at 8 am on Monday morning and while this wasn't their fault, the elevator was out all morning which meant many guests who didn't wish or were unable to climb stairs were taking up the entire lobby making it very hard to come and go. I wouldn't think the elevator would need to be out for hours after a false alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: indianqueen39
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strathcona Hotel in July and would highly recommend it. Our room(for 3) was on the small side, however my parents' double room was much bigger. The rooms were clean. the staff were friendly and helpful. We initially booked a taxi to take us to the airport, however I noticed the Express bus across the road. this worked out cheaper for the 5 of us rather than the taxi. the lady in the 'hole in the wall' charged $76 - less than the adverstised price. CN Tower and water front are all within wlaking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own towels and soap”
Reviews.Author: mighty_a
Reviews.Content: Great location and relatively quiet are the positives. The towels seem like you're drying with sand paper. I guess they never heard of fabric softener. The soap and shampoo are in dispensers. In the shower one dispenser is for bath gel and shampoo. All-in-one?? Of course you must use a washcloth, which is like wet sandpaper. WiFi is not free so go across the street to Tim Hortons.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the station, clean, bright and modern”
Reviews.Author: CasperSydney
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a wet and cold day so were relieved that the proximity to Via railway station was as close as advertised. We were also pleased that the Strathcona was a short walk [ c 3 blocks] to Eaton Place - a major shopping area and to some reasonnable local restaurants. The staff on reception were very helpful and friendly, particularly the older gentleman who tok time o chat and gave us discount tickets to a local Italian restaurant [ not very good!] and also allowed us a slightly later check out for an evening flight, for which we were grateful and would recommend on that basis alone. We were very impressed by the quality of the room and bathroom which were both large and very modern and clean. All white walls and polished floors with red accents. Was not sure about the red light in the cupboard but this seemed to go out by itself. There were generous supplies of ground coffee satchets which allowed us a morning and evening brew, something we particularly appreciate, when so many hotels in the US and Canada only provide one sachet per person. There were no bathroom minatures but shampoo and soap were supplied via dispensers and seemed of reasonnable quality. Room make up was good and inobtrusive. The bed was comfortable and we were unaware of any noise from the street. There is a Tim Hortons across the street for a light breakfast and although the hotel breakfast looked nice it was on the expensive side for us. Tours can be booked at a desk in reception but we found that locating tours to Niagra and transfers to the airport on departure were cheaper via the internet than the private tour operator in reception. Our final bill included a hefty mark up for two local calls which left a sour note but definite value for money for rather nice hotel providing you don't use their telephone.

Reviews.Title: “Must read this review before booking”
Reviews.Author: cutenclassy
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels Ive stayed at while visiting Toronto, this was the worst (besides a small very cheap inn). Waaaayyyy over priced for a closet sized room. Compared to other hotels in the area, this was the worst deal. Please consider other hotels as this one is def not worth the money. Choose any one of the hotels in the same price range and they will all be much better. Good location but tiny room (barely fit the bed) and a very very small bathroom. This room reminded me of a small motel rather then a DT hotel..Certainly not worth 180.00 that we paid. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel with great services and very well located”
Reviews.Author: cwamboo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent one night in the Suite of the Stratchona Hotel for our anniversary. The lobby is at the same time cosy and elegant, the suite is spacious and furnished with taste (very nice shower, king-size bed and sofa). We particularly appreciated the brightness of the room. Perfect location after a diner at the top of the CN tower!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the city...”
Reviews.Author: saxonkc
Reviews.Content: We selected The Strathcona for it's location close to Air Canada Center and other attractions in downtown Toronto. Everything you need is within a short walking distance. The quality of the room is good, on the small side if you are not used to staying in downtown hotels. Plenty of room for a couple but would be a tight fit for a family of four. Our view was of the skyscrapers surrounding the hotel since we were only on the 3rd floor. I would request a room on a higher floor on our next visit. We received excellent service from check-in and through out our stay. Hotel staff were always availible to answer questions and provide great advice on sight seeing and other items. Would definately stay at The Strathcona on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: scs1207
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Strathcona for the final night of our vacation, mainly because of the location in the heart of downtown and its proximity to the Airport Express. The rooms are generally very small, but comfortable and clean. Don't expect any views, though. I can't say anything about breakfast as it is not included, so we had ours at the Tim Hortons across the street :-). You have to pay for internet access in the rooms and in the business centre, unless you only use it for web check-in and printing out your boarding passes, which is free. All in all you get good value for your money, but I wouldn't recommend this placed for extented stays, as you will probably get claustrophobic after 2 or 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “I'm amazed”
Reviews.Author: Brenda503
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Strathcona. Rate was very good compared to other hotels in the downtown area. Room was on the small side but very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly with a sense of humor. With so much to do in the vicinity of the hotel, it was the perfect place for us. I would definitely be booking this hotel for our next trip to Toronto. Thank you so much Strathcona Employees for making our visit fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: I ended up choosing this hotel due to its proximity to Toronto Union Station as I was catching VIA Rail at the end of my stay. It is also close to CN Tower and Yonge/Dundas is only about 10 minutes away. I ended up walking all over downtown Toronto and I found the location of The Strathcona pretty central. Checking in and out was extremely efficient and the hotel looked recently renovated and the hallways were the brightest I have seen for a while. Rooms had timber flooring which I think is cleaner than carpet anyway. There is only a small tv which was actually in the closet but I didn't spend much time in front of it anyway so wasn't an issue. My only gripe about this hotel was the lack of free internet but then Second Cup Coffee and Starbucks are close by. I didn't eat at the breakfast cafe downstairs nor did I visit the pub as I was too busy exploring the rest of downtown Toronto and there is plenty to eat in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time`s a charm”
Reviews.Author: Buster1966
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for St-Patrick`s day. Arrived to check in and was presented with room 911. Got to the room and to my surprise, the bed looked like it was just slept in... Called the front desk to advise and they asked that I come down to get another room key. Got room 810 and as I entered, an over whelming odor of paint almost knocked me over. The window was open but it was obvious the room had been recently repainted. Again... called the front desk to let them know what the issue was and that I was requesting a new room... I was asked to wait a moment and put on hold. After about 2 minutes, the desk clerk entered the room to escort me to my 3rd room. This one seemed ok (bed was made, no paint smell) but as I turned the water on to take a shower, the handle came off into my hand:) Rooms are small and very crowded with too much oversized furniture. The floors were redone with annoying laminate... no carpet... No apologies from the staff regarding my having to be moved to 3 dif. rooms until one was acceptable, bad fit and finish on the room renovations, poor furniture size to room size ratio. All in all, I would recommend staying at the Royal York (across the street) for $20 more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: RyanS1976
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel close to the train station, close to the Air Canada Centre and close to downtown...the Strathcona Hotel gave me all 3 and without an outrageous pricetag. The staff was incredibly friendly, the lobby was comfortable to hang out in. The rooms were adequate for a short stay. I will definitely stay there again when I return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, noisy, no window, not clean no air extractor in bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: fls4586
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because it had somehow good reviews. I assume it has better rooms than the one we had. The room was tiny and only had a window that faced another room a couple of meters away. We noticed the ventilation from the bathroom was not working from day one. The bathroom is tiny, and the ceiling is lower than that one of the room, the same height as the door frame. This converted the entire room into a sauna after taking a shower. It was all so wet that the bathroom mirror stayed moist until the next day. We were told it was normal, the ventilation didn't work for the whole hotel. There is no free internet you have to pay 10$ per day, and the breakfast is 15$ + tax. We found hairs inside the bed before using it..., we hoped they washed the sheets and the hairs somehow survived. The room door has a gap on the lower area, which allowed all sound to come in from the hallway. The first day we were woken up by a group of people leaving at 5am, then another at 6 an 7:30. This continued to be a routine for the rest of the stay. The only good thing I can say about the hotel is that it is located in downtown, near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a cheap price (look online)”
Reviews.Author: Scrumble
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from Union Station and 2 blocks from the metro toronto convention centre. I got the room for $97 + tax online. You have to book online as the hotel will not match prices. The rooms are very small but have all the basic amenities and was clean and updated. There is no fridge or pool. The main drawback for me was the not well insulated walls and windows. The street noise was quite loud as were sounds from other rooms. That's what you get for such a good price right downtown. Bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: amandah62
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of March 2011 for the Juno awards, and this hotel is in an excellent location if you plan on going to the Air Canada Centre, or Rogers Centre, CN Tower etc. It's also right beside LightBox (which is where the Tim Burton exhibit is held) and it was about a 10 minute walk from out hotel which we were really pleased about. Infront of the hotel is a small store, and a Tim Hortons. The rooms were a big small, but reasonable for the amount of time spent in them. TV: You get alot of channels to choose from, which is great. The walls are pretty thin, as we had some drunk people on our floor. ( not the hotels fault obviously) I don't know what the other views of the rooms are like, but we had rooms on the 3rd floor and 9th floor and both views were the wall of the buildings. No light etc. Other then that, the hotel is in a great location, and it was comfy, the staff was excellent. One of the down sides was that it doesnt offer free wifi which most hotels do.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: DharmamamaOntario
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and there was some poor workmanship in the finish in the bathroom, plus the walls were very thin, but overall, it was really good. The service was excellent, the staff did everything they could to help. The housekeeping staff especially were wonderful. The rooms have recently been updated, and it was very nicely done with a couple of innovative touches (red bulb in the closet!) Location was great, though no parking was available.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rachael00
Reviews.Content: This Strathcona Hotel offered an extremely comfortable stay. The front desk staff demonstrated friendliness and provided quick service upon my check in and checks out. My trip was with a few friends and the purpose was to enjoy downtown Toronto. I found it particularly convenient that the manager (Brandon) organized getting tickets to the NHL hockey game. In addition, the manager provided us with an upgrade to a more modern and newly renovated room. The room was clean and the bed was highly comfortable which made for a good nigh stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to negative reviews -- great cheap alternative to Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: Jodster123
Reviews.Content: I was VERY impressed with the Strathcona! I had e-mailed the manager a month before our stay and asked if there was anything special that could be done for our stay as we are newly engaged. He responded by upgrading our room to an executive suite. That being said, I would highly recommend paying the extra money and getting an executive suite. The suite wasn't large -- probably a normal hotel room size -- but it was probably MUCH larger than the regular rooms, which I've heard are quite small. The room was clean and well appointed. What's more, the bed was surprisingly very comfortable! Think of it as an upgraded European-style hotel with smaller rooms but with more comfortable beds and very comfortable bathrooms in the rooms! Some people have complained about the individual air conditioners/heaters in the rooms, but I liked it! It was nice to be able to adjust your own heat for once! We had it just as toasty as we liked. This hotel was a great alternative to the MUCH more expensive Fairmont Royal York across the street, and if you're not planning on spending much time in your room anyways, it's perfect! We were there on vacation and were always away during the day -- doing some shopping, walking around, going to restaurants, doing tours, etc. It was just the perfect location for all of this. The convention centre is just around the corner, Union Station is extremely close, Eaton Centre is a 10 minute walk and it's not far at all from great restaurants and other shopping areas. There is also a Tim Hortons right across the street, if you're so inclined. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for its great location and the great service from the staff!! We asked for a later check-out and it was given, no problem. We also asked if they could hold our bags for us, because we had a late evening flight out of Toronto, and that was also not a problem at all. You could tell they really tried to do their best for their customers. Another great plus was we used the Airport Express from the airport and it dropped us off right in front of the Fairmont and we just walked across the street to the Strathcona. And we caught it back from the Fairmont as well -- very convenient. It was a HUGE money saver compared to a cab, and we just walked everywhere while we in the city. But if you're leaving for the airport during rush hour, be sure to alot an extra hour or so -- the driver tries his best to get you there as quickly as possible, but there's not much you can do to get past traffic on the expressway. For a nearby restaurant with reasonable prices, go to Alice Fazooli's. It's great for a dinner out in Toronto, and it won't break the bank. It was one of the only places we found after 5 PM that didn't charge a crazy amount , wasn't fast food and was actually incredibly good. It's Italian food, excellent service and it's a beautiful restaurant, too.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: travlinguy6562
Reviews.Content: I had planned a trip with a close friend to Toronto and wanted to find a great, clean hotel close to theater and shopping and the church street area. I found this hotel on hotels.com and looked though the photos and fell in love with the gorgeous bathroom and knew this was the hotel for me. I saw that they had only a twin bed option. i called the 866 number to see if there was a way to get a queen bed option. they were happy to offer that style room for a slight additional price. i was happy to pay for that bathroom. Upon arriving, we pulled up and ran in with the luggage and asked if i could leave the luggage here while we park the car next door( motioning to the left of the hotel) . he asked if it had a lap top in the bags. i said no, so he said fine. really? that makes a difference in if he can keep a eye on it? odd. we parked right next door for 14 a night( saturday is free ( score!) and we went back to check in to the hotel. as we were checked in, i asked if i they validate parking tickets. they asked which lot we were parked in. i motioned, once again to the lot to the left of the hotel. thye said not that one because it is more expensive and no overnight security. um, so why did you not tell me when i told you i was going to park my car, that you have a preferred parking that you validate??? or even recommend? got the keys for the 5th floor room. went up. small but clean, nice looking, new;y redone room. but.. what the hell with the bathroom. nothing like the pictures. I went down to ask about it. after they searched the web to see what pics that hotel.com used, they informed me that isa only the the suite. I said, it is implied, that that is the bathroom that is with the room. they offered me another room at a higher price and offered to show it to me. i went to the 9th floor. slightly larger room but same crappy bathroom. i declined. the room we were originally offered has no working vent so you either have to shower with the door open, and never take a crap, or suck it up and deal. the ceiling is peeling from humidity. the room has no mini fridge. and absolutely no hanging clothing space.. ok, slight exaggeration, it had 9 inches of clothing hang space. one winter coat could fit. no space for luggage at all. to place or store. just because the room looks good in pictures does not mean it is a functioning room. needs storage, mini fridge, vent, no deceptive advertising, and double paned windows. i know it is the city but, cheaper hotels in town have less sound. better windows. deeply underwhelmed. and no one did anything to make it better. thank you staff. ... cricket , cricket..... see the tumbleweeds?.... oh, and in the lobby, there is a big flatscreen advertisinf 2 for 1 tickets at the cn tower. I wanted to take me friend there. went to the lobby and asked. i was told, they have no tickets. um.. then why advertise? once again... thank yOU ps.. not near theater and downtown. not free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Very Tiny Room but served the purpose. Clean and got a good rate thru EasyClick”
Reviews.Author: 1952jake
Reviews.Content: The room was teeny tiny! But we were only there for sleep.. The shower was cold... Very clean and quiet.. Have stayed there a couple times before. Very close to Air Canada Centre and nightlife post Leafs game..

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: newfgirl
Reviews.Content: for just sleeping it is a great value and great location. clean but very small rooms. alot of noice as well from alley and corridors which can be creepy waking you at 3am..if not spending anytime in hotel it is good value

Reviews.Title: “Great location; OK room; mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Rick010
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I was greeted professionally and checked in quickly with a minimum of chirpiness or extraneous hoo-ha -- just the way I like it. I don't need to be made to feel like a long-lost friend, I just want to get to my room. The room itself was okay. It was very clean and the bed was comfortable; those are the two most important things. The free wifi was also a very big plus. On the downside: it was quite small (not a big deal for a business traveler like myself), the floor was some kind of fake hardwood (Pergo?), and while there were two "workspaces" (each one a tiny wooden board affixed to the wall) the only one with room for the task chair was the one without any electrical outlet nearby. In order to plug my laptop into the wall, I had to run an extension cord under a bench by the bed. The hard floor was an issue for three reasons: first, it makes the room feel more institutional and less homey; second, it's cold in Toronto in February; and third, it doesn't absorb any of the slush and water that comes in on your shoes, which means that the floor ends up not only cold and hard, but also dirty and wet. Ugh. The Strathcona's location is great; right downtown, close to several good restaurants of various kinds. I had no complaints about the service until the evening, when I went downstairs to use the "business center" (an extremely old, slow computer seemingly held together with duct tape). I needed to print up the PowerPoint slides for my presentation the next day. I fully expected to pay for that service, and when I asked the guy at the desk how much it would cost, he said that it would be a per-minute charge and I'd only be charged for the time I spent logged on. Not true. I was charged both for the time I spent logged on, and another 50 cents per page for the printouts. Even that wouldn't have been so bad, except that the toner cartridge was almost empty, which meant that the printouts were barely legible. (To his credit, the guy at the desk offered to reprint them for me on their office machine.) In the morning, when I tried to take a shower, there was barely enough hot water to make the experience bearable. I mentioned this to the desk attendant as I checked out. She furrowed her brow and left it at that, so I'm not sure how committed this hotel actually is to dealing with that (pretty significant, if you ask me) problem. In short, would I recommend the Strathcona? Yes, if you're traveling alone, staying for only one night, and need easy access to the convention center. Otherwise, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull”
Reviews.Author: Grundy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on a Saturday night, the location was good close to the ACC and other attractions, however this is where the good ends, as we went to go to bed there were bugs in the bed, yikes, so we called down and asked to be moved which we were down to the second floor, however, when we pulled the sheets back there was hair and dirt on the sheets! We were then moved to the 11 floor which was finally clean although we slept on top on the sheets. In the am we asked to be reimbursed for the room and they offered us 25% off, my brother in law got them up to 50%, although I will be e-mailing the manager after I finish writing this. So all in all this is a great place to bring your enemies. My dryer just went off ( all of our clothes from the room in case we brought home any freinds from the room) so I will end this rant.

Reviews.Title: “great modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: icedaddyuk
Reviews.Content: Looking at other peoples pictures of the rooms, I think they must have been refurbished since then, as the rooms were very modern, wood floors, up lighting, flat screen TVs etc. The hotel is in a good location, just ten minutes walk to the CN tower and ten minute walk to the Eaton Shopping Center. There is no parking at the hotel but there is a lot right next to the hotel. It is quite low so if you have a big vehicle you may not get in. The parking is around $15/day at weekends, more during the week. Very comfortable beds and good value for money. There is a restaurant attached but it was closed when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not noise proof -- I was awake half the night.”
Reviews.Author: Artbusiness
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location a half block from Union Station, but the value prooved to be a false economy. The room for one was tiny and awkward. The bathroom so small it was almost useless and the tub uncomfortable if you intend to soak. There is no desk, so business travellers should know this. The decor was new and fresh and the bed linens clean and fresh white cotton. The bed was comfortable, and the cleanliness was impeccable. The floor is fake wood parquet not carpeted, so cold. The "closet" was unacceptably small, only about 6 inches wide, and included only two hangars. And the heat is a blower type too loud to leave on during the night (and only feet from the bed), so I was cold all night in early December. All of this would have been acceptable because the price came to only $113 CD for the evening, but I was woken up by maid service delivering something to the next door neighbors at 4am, then kept awake for the next two hours by the couple in the room above mine who were making love. The ceiling has no soundproofing, and you could hear everything: creaking bed springs,voices, as if they were in the same room, etc. . It was like a bad movie. I completely tired the next day and angry. The room was cute but absolutely not worth the cheap rate. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and everything was extra....Not much for customer service or making one feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Travel333333A
Reviews.Content: Am I right, Isn't the only job of a good hotel: customer comfort? The rate was much higher than quoted with my via rail package. i wish I had gone across the street, (That hotel has a doorman, ambiance, coffee, nice guests, amenities, quoted at only 25 dollars more. I had just come from 5 days on the train. Via rail spoiled me: good food, calm service, clean sheets, clean bathrooms, nice passengers. At this hotel. my bath room was only marginally clean, the walls were crumbling under the wall paper, the service was rude, the food at the hotel was the worst I had in years. Zero ammenities. Everything was extra and under par: 10 dollars for internet service, not a single urn of coffee or hot water in site day or night. The morning breakfast option was a 16 dollar buffet of over cooked options, The salad dressing from my roomservice ceaser salad repeated for one whole day!!!! When I arrived the lobby was filled with surly young men who would not part a path for me (a tiny woman) to get to the elevator with two bags and a violin in a travel case , The lobby is cramped and uncomfortable, and not at all private. It is just a glorified glass booth right on the edge of the side walk. Only one sofa.The decorations were sparce as if they had been robbed. The hotel pub after 7 pm was an unsafe bet for a small town girl travelling alone. The front desk staff was young, unsure, indifferent, and untrained. There was no lotion, no sewing kit. I requested a sewing kit . I had to ask the staff on another floor.The microscopic one they found was no bigger than a matchbook with not enough thread to sew on two buttons. It took the staff an hour to locate one. The clothes saga: There is no laundry to self wash clothes. I checked in at 9 AM and they could not provide me with laundry services by dinner time.. or even before 11 AM the next day. Why should it take more than 26 hours to wash two pairs of slacks? Why should that cost be 19 dollars when it is neither fast or easy. They would not offer run the clothes back up to me, They called and told me they made a mistake that the clothes could not be done by the time my next train left. I had to run down three times waiting for the clothes the whole ordeal took 85 minutes. They had told me if I did not come down in 10 minutes I would not be able to get them back as it was the shift change. Summary: bad food, not so clean, bad atmosphere, indifferent service, hidden costs, everything extra, no coffee or tea, no soap or shampoos except for low quality dispensers attached to the wall with strong smelling products.total cost for one night came to over 200 dollars Canadian. Good thing: beds were comfortable. I was a little distressed at my recent Toronto experience. In general I found it rude and indifferent. Two blocks from the hotel men in expensive suits and coats smoked outside their 5 star resaturants, and high rise offices while homeless people huddled in corners or slept shoeless in minus five degree weather. The streets are stained with garbage on the outsdie while the elite undergound walkways, and posh shops are warm and gleam.. so who cares ...right?

Reviews.Title: “Strathcona is modern, clean, central”
Reviews.Author: flandaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located pretty centrally, not far from union station. The rooms look newly done; wood floors, new linens, fixtures. The alarm clock was an iPod player and the TV was nice. The bed was comfortable and big. The bathroom was also very clean, the shower had good pressure. The sink was a little amusing....not sure if they were aiming for 'space-saving' or' modern', but the tap is sideways which makes it hard to wash your face! Our view was, well, a building. Can't expect much I guess from downtown Toronto. There is no parking but there is a parking garage literally next door that charges a max of $7 per 12 hours. the receptionist could've been more friendly. For example, she wouldn't give directions to the greyhound directly, referred us to the concierge. Didn't ruin my day. We suggest you stop by Longo's market, yes its a grocery place, but they have a great deli section for lunch. We also noticed the Porter Airlines Bus and the Greyhound stop across the street from the hotel. A short walk gets you to Eaton Centre, sightseeing. We didn't eat at the pub that is connected to the hotel, or at the cafe, so I don't have any info for that. All in all, I will stay there again, good price for a clean, modern stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location excellent value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: okamod2
Reviews.Content: Had a dinner event at the Royal York, just around the corner, and the next day a conference at the MTCC, a short block away! And for a fraction of the cost of the Royal York or Intercontinental! Rooms were modern and clean and I would definitly stay there again... only thing was the hair conditioner in the bathroom was empty so I called front desk to have them bring some up... didn't have time to wait so went without... when we were about to leave a knock to the door... someone was there to fix the air conditioner!! LOL... not a complaint, just a humourous anticdote....

Reviews.Title: “okay, a place when you're stuck”
Reviews.Author: valbushey
Reviews.Content: we were moved to this hotel,because ours was over booked. the rooms are very clean, and up to date. The staff is very limited on the english lanuage. they also are rude. parking is to far form the hotel, if you are young and in shape it is no problem,however you almost need a taxi to get to and from the parking. And very expensive. between$15 and $18 to park. you have to pay each you go in. also the hotel was to provide us with breakfeast ,because of our trouble,and never came through with it. The elevator is very unsafe,it skips floors, and does not stop completely when it has reached the picked floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eponine18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 401. The room had been newly repainted and the bed was new. TV was old fashioned but access to plenty of cable channels. The room was quite small however there was adequate room for 2 of us and we stayed 10 nights so had a lot of luggage. The closet was very small and some of the sockets were unpredictable. Maid service was excellent and the room kept clean. The hotel itself is in a great location just a few blocks from the CN Tower. it was no problem to walk everywhere downtown and the hotel is around the corner from Union Station so close to transoprt links. I didnt uase the Wifi but there are 2 computer terminals downstairs that you can print out boarding cards from (for free) and you can pay to use the internet on these (minimum charge of $3). The breakfast (a buffet costing $15 per person) was not very nice but there are plenty of places nearby that yu can get food and drinks. Overall it is a nice hotel and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what the pictures show PLUS no parking!”
Reviews.Author: start_0ver
Reviews.Content: There is no parking associated with this hotel so if you have a car you have to park it in any number of parking garages nearby..the only downside to that is that for 2 days in a garage costs $76 USD. The pictures online of the rooms are not at all what the rooms really look like. We got a room with 2 double beds and could barely open the door to our room without hitting one of the beds. Also, you could not open the door to the bathroom all the way because of the odd structural layout. The bedding was disgusting and after 2 nights staying there a few of us woke up with bites on us (of unknown causes but possibly bed bugs?). The rates at this hotel are comparable to other hotels in Toronto but the lack of parking, lack of breakfast, and having to pay $10 USD a day for internet access (for only 1 device at a time) is BS.
