The only up side to this hotel is that it is literally in the heart of the city within walking distance from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silvertravellers60
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in very convenient position. Rooms a little small but very clean and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Small, euro-style rooms for solo travelers; don't bring a car”
Reviews.Author: RickG23
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed in small city hotels in Europe, you'll be familiar with the rooms at the Strathcona. Room 1024 was about 150 square feet plus the bath. Very recently remodeled. Furnished in upper-range Ikea. I liked the laminate floors (these were clean). New bed. Adequate storage. Nice lighting scheme. Newly fitted bathroom, again small, but with a shower/bathtub. Decent AC. No view. Overall a nice comfortable room for one. Though catagorized as a double, there's really not enough room for two people. On the negative side, the wall-mounted flat panel in this room was located in an awkward, nearly unwatchable position. Should have been fitted with a swing arm. I don't watch much TV so this was a minor issue for me. But this room also was lacking the (supposedly standard) ipod dock. Also, wireless internet access costs 10 dollars a day. Ugh. (You can print boarding passes free of charge in the lobby). Location - downtown - is a big plus. Toronto is a great city for walking around. Lack of valet parking is a very big minus. If you are driving into Toronto, this oversight might be a dealbreaker.

Reviews.Title: “A very average kinda place”
Reviews.Author: Godby
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that you neither love nor hate. It's just an average kinda place. A bit on the old and tired side. We stayed in a standard room with two single beds and it was really tiny. I didn't measure it but it was approx 12 x 15 feet and the bathroom was as small as could be (couldn't comfortably get two people in it at the same time). But on the plus side, it was fairly clean. Couldn't complain about that. And the location was good for the financial and entertainment districts although a long walk from the Bloor/Yorkville area (35-40 min).I would probably stay here again but I would opt for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Darlene_O
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent 2 days in Toronto. We stayed at the Strathcona becasue of location. We arrived in hte city Via go train. The hotel was only a few minutes from Union Station. It is also in the financial distrcit, just on the edge of the entertainment district. If you are hoping to see a show speak to the Concierge. They are most helpful. The front desk staff were efficient during check in and check out. There was no microwave or fridge in the room, but the beds were comfy and the shower HOT! What more could two girls want for a weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel to visit Toronto, but .....”
Reviews.Author: mammonaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Strathcona Hotel in Toronto. The hotel was v e r y well situated, near the railway station, the bus tours, restaurants, the CN tower etc. The hotel reception, the breakfast room and the hotel rooms were very clean and nice. Just don't bring to much luggage...the rooms are so small, the others have to sit on their bed if one has to go to the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rainey73
Reviews.Content: The best thing about The Strathcona is its location, right in the middle of Downtown Toronto, very close to the main attractions. However, the rooms are very small and if you get allocated Room 221 refuse it immediately - it has 3 air conditioning vents right outside the window and it was absolutely impossible for me to get any sleep. The hotel couldn't move us immediately because the hotel was full but did so the next day. If you are looking for a room with a view you won't get it here as it is surroundedby high rise buildings - the higher up you can get the better. The concierge service is great giving us some very helpful hints and getting us a good deal on car hire. Overall an average hotel which is a little overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: weaselbob74
Reviews.Content: We went to Niagara Falls, and decided to go to Toronto without a real plan. We didn't research hotels prior to arriving. So we went to the Radisson, and their rates were around $215. We just needed a place to sleep for the night, so they recommended the Strathcona. We didn't feel like driving around, and we had no phone reception, so we just went there and recieved a Queen sized room for $155. We went up the the room, and the first thing we noticed was how small it was. It was sufficient for us, but maybe not for some other patrons. It was very clean, and well kept. We took a nap, and we were waken by the loudest water pipes I have ever heard. But other than that it was a decent room. Not worth $155 though. And there was no parking provided, so your on your own for that as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Classic”
Reviews.Author: RamblinTamale
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strathcona overnite July 10. I loved the rich wood and glass of the hotel, it made me feel like I had somehow stepped back in time. The room was small but very comfortable, great bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This is a hotel for travellers, excellent location, easy access to subway, airport express, and would recommend it to anyone, good price too about 150 CAD. RamblinGal

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see the whole city ... very simple understated”
Reviews.Author: ADD_BeachLovers
Reviews.Content: This is not a "fancy" hotel. We are a couple in late 20s early 30s. We love to eat out, sightseeing, and city walks. The hotel is in a central location, and near great areas on Queen and King streets (and University). The hotel is clean. The basic room is small, but then again if you are going to be touring the city you will barely spend time in the room. Closet is tiny but useful. Shower was clean. Sheets were clean. The hotel was quiet on the nights I was here. (5 nights). There is a vending machine on each floor. Their staff is helpful, and friendly. My iron did not work, so they replaced it within minutes. It is very close to Union Station, and across from the YORK hotel were the Airport express bus stops. They have a restaurant, breakfast buffet is about $14. The only negative is having to pay $10 for 1 day of internet or $20 for 3 days. If you are staying here for business then it is not really economical, otherwise is not bad. I would definitely stay here again. Great if you are looking for nice under $180.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: gbod7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a concert being held at the Air Canada Centre, so I thought the location of this hotel was very convenient. I purchased the room in advanced online, so it was a better rate, but I find it a little over priced for the quality of the hotel. The room was definitely tiny, even though I booked a KING Executive Suite. The washroom floor was dirty, and there was a hair in the bathtub. The Air Conditioner was blowing warm air, so I could not sleep all night. The DO NOT DISTURB sign was missing from the room, so I went to the front desk to request a sign, the staff member did not seem to care. Hotel is a bit outdated for the price they are charging. I don't think I will return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice week in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Reisende87
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for less than a week. I wanted to get a glimpse of the city and do some shopping while staying in a comfortable and economic place. The Strathcona Hotel was a perfect choice. It's situated in a very safe location, near to the union station and in walking distance from the harbor. The room was clean, small but there was enough space for a normal person! A Tim Horton's was just across the street, which saved me breakfast and internet money at the hotel. They charge you for the internet per day so it's not very pricey and it's fast! The view from the room wasn't really interesting, but iI only used it to sleep, was always on the go! It's a quiet location so you can have sweet dreams :) This is a good place for any backpacker or friends who are looking for a nice place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “great location, decent service”
Reviews.Author: xyutou
Reviews.Content: conveniently located next to the financial district, this hotel is within walking distance to the lake shore board walk, church street, lawrence market and dundas square. also it is 2 blocks away from metro station and union train station. great location to explore downtown toronto. room is small but cozy, with hardwood floor. however, light sleepers should try to book a room away from the street side. morning traffic can be loud. hotel cafe (york street cafe) and pub (the pub) are mediocre, better dining options are a few blocks away towards church st. and lawrence market. booking thru skoosh provided a good discount, wifi costs extra 20$ for a 3-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION - GREAT PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELING-REGINA
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location could not be any better - across the street from the Union Square train station and the airport shuttle pickup/drop off. There is a coffee shop and news stand right across the street as well. I went for the sole purpose of visiting Rogers Centre for a baseball game and it was just down the street - 10 min walk max. All the major attractions are located with a 10 minute walk. Very convenient to get around. The hotel has a concierge who was very helpful and knowledgeable and they also sell tickets (sometimes discounted) to the attractions around town so you don't have to wait in line for tickets. Room was very clean - liked the hard-wood floors as opposed to carpet. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Room very quiet at night. Shutters on the windows instead of blinds also a nice touch. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation and would stay there again for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfectly serviceable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesJ1120
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to all the major tourist sights as well as the subway. Room was on the small side, but fine - very clean, good linens, nice bed, bathroom. Hotel staff was o.k. - not particularly friendly and the concierge was not all that knowledgeable and in fact gave us incorrect info. Ask for a quiet room and a remodeled room -- we asked for both and were pleased -- our room was extremely quiet . All in all, it was a good experience - the price was right - much cheaper than most similar hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and service have gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: kwbCanada
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Strathcona's small but fine rooms several times before, I returned in May 2010 for five nights. It did not meet expectations this time. The rooms remain small but clean and quite adequate, though the new decor now gives it a budget appearance though the prices have increased. Maintenance seems to have become problematic; when one of two elevators failed, staff just sighed and exclaimed that shucks this happens whenever it gets busy. Ventilation wasn't great, but opening the window was impossible due to a greasy kitchen smell from somewhere outside. Communication with staff was unhelpful. The hotel's posted info suggests we leave towels hanging if we want to reuse them rather than having them changed each day, to save environmental impact. Reception staff repeatedly smilingly noted that towels were being changed even though directions for having them left for reuse had been followed, but nothing changed. Internet access was problematic, and staff's response was remarkable. Despite what other guests around me asserted, and what is also reported in reviews here, I was assured my computer must be the culprit as their computer system works fine. I was unable to send emails during my entire stay, despite spending time with their tech support; the problem resolved as soon as I crossed the street to Union Station. One manager's kind offer to just use his cable connection to circumvent my problems with their wireless was unfortunately not available as others were by then on duty. The hilariously ironic thing is that my reply to their email requesting Guest Feedback was returned undeliverable, and when I phoned to advise them of this, I received the same chatty unhearing reception on the phone as had been available in person. The best thing about this hotel is its close proximity to Union Station.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location (and value)”
Reviews.Author: ExPatinNica
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel across the street from the Fairmont Royal York and a short walk to the convention center- ie perfect location if you are in Toronto on a business trip. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful (even though I got a cheap, prepaid internet rate). The hotel was clean, the one room-service meal I got was good, reasonably-priced and delivered as promised in 15 minutes flat. The WiFi worked flawlessly for my entire 3 day stay. What's not to like? The room is small - which was OK with me. There was a moderate amount of noise from the hallway audible at night, and the room doors are very noisy when they close. This woke me up several times during the night all 3 nights. Also I don't really like the dispensers of "soap/shampoo" nondescript gel. I would recommend this hotel for the budget-conscious business traveler but with the above comments.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: IceMtl
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona hotel is conveniently located just across Union Station right downtown Toronto. For business traveler arriving either by train or by Toronto Island Airport, the location is optimal. The hotel has gone through a recent remodel and the rooms, although small, are well appointed. This is definitively a European style hotel both design and size wise. You cannot find a cheaper choice right smac downtown Toronto period. So you get what you pay for, that is, a ''clean'' basic room with minimum amenities. If you a light sleeper and need total quit and obscurity in your room then this is NOT an hotel for you. Lots of noises come from the thin windows/door and from the bathroom pipes. There are no drapes on the windows only blinds that don't block 100% of the light. MANAGEMENT READ THE FOLLOWING: The only real problem, in my opinion, with the hotel has to do with how the rooms are cleaned after a guess checks out. Since the floors are laminate I guess the hotel management think the maids don't have to vacuum them. I changed room during my stay because of the noise and both rooms had the same issue. The floors are dirty and full of hair. I litterally had to take a damp towel and clean the floor to get rid of all the hair. I had enough in the end to manufacture a wig. I noticed the maids don't even have a vacuum cleaner when they service the room. Fix this and also clean the doors jams of all the dirty black finger marks and you'll have a better rating next time.

Reviews.Title: “It's fair, but beware...”
Reviews.Author: psmith45
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers of this place have said, the rooms are very small, though clean for the most part. It was apparently renovated some years ago and is a lot nicer than it was. Probably cheaper than anything else in this area. I didn't find any problems with noise, as others have commented. The only complaints I have are that: one, the breakfast buffet is incredibly overpriced; and two, the staff deceived me into thinking I was getting free internet (I called after 10 pm and they desk staff told me he'd let me have it for free) yet when I got the bill the next day, they charged me full price for it, and wouldn't even take the cost - a lousy 10 bucks - off my bill. I really don't like being treated that way by staff, so I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: vixx83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in March 2010. The main reason I booked the hotel is the location, it is round the corner from Union Station, so perfect if you are arriving or departing by train. You are within walking distance of the Entertainment District which is full of bars and restaurants, as well as Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre for good shopping. Our room was fairly small but nicely decorated and the bathroom was clean and fairly modern. One bad thing was theat the walls are very thin so you can hear quite a lot of noise if people are coming and going in other rooms nearby. We did not try the cafe or pub so can't comment on these but overall, this is a good hotel to see the sights of Toronto and is very well priced for the area it is in. I would stay here again if I were to return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again - excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: amburr
Reviews.Content: If your stay in Toronto keeps you in the downtown core or anywhere on the subway line the location of the Strathcona cannot be beat. A major subway/rail/regional transit hub is less than a block away, as is a major stop for the main airport express company. In addition, service is excellent. Staff went out of their way to accommodate my business-related requests. In addition, room service was prompt and checkin/checkout very professional. Rooms are cozy but clean (including laminate floors, not grungy carpet) and housekeeping takes their job seriously (to the point of changing the bed coverlet daily!). My only caution with the Strathcona is that it is an old building, which means paper thin walls. I asked for a quiet room and got one with only one shared wall. Out of six nights I used ear plugs one night to get to sleep but that's not a bad average even in the best of hotels. For the price and location, I think that's a small concession to make.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to discuss-dated dirty noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bossdog80
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while attending a social event. The room is tiny, the bed soft, the sheets poor quality, noisy old electric heater on the wall. Room was freezing upon arrival and then quickly hot and dry with the 50 year old in wall heater. Wallpaper peeling, bathroom dated and dirty. Needed a room so I stayed, but only becuase the other hotels were full. Paid over two hundred bucks....will never even think of going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: jlmOntario
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times, due to the fact that the cost/night is so cheap compared to everything in the area! Rooms are clean, but very small (the ones that we have had do not look like the pictures on their website). The price is great if you book in advance. Especially in regards to the location of the hotel. There is parking nearby & underneath the building, at a reasonable rates. There is a restaurant/lounge in the hotel, which we have never been to, but always seems to be busy. The location - Fantastic, your close to the CN tower, ACC, Hockey Hall of fame, Shopping, Theatres. We also walk to all of these places when we stay here! If you like really fancy and elegant, probably not the best hotel for you. But if your looking for great location at half the price, and don't really mind the small rooms I definately reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dabrador
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel for business, I like to try different hotels, especially boutique style hotels. The Strathcona was a nice place with lots of potential. Check-in was pleasant and quick. I was given one of the newly remodeled rooms with all wood floors. I liked this as it felt cleaner. Upon entering the room, there was some classical music playing from the clock radio...nice touch! The room had a European feel to it. I didn't think it was small...just right. If you like your rooms fat and large, you may not like this. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. There was a small stain on the bed spread but other than that, the stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: raticca01
Reviews.Content: I had a good expereince where staff was very helpful and polite. The hotel is smack in the middle of all the important downtown places, with easy access to public transportation. I did my research so I was not shocked at the small room. For the price paid it was definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good at a reduced price”
Reviews.Author: moderate12
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a standard room (their smallest) at the Strathcona for one night on a business trip at a reduced rate from EasyClickTravel of $79 plus the $10 for wireless access. I thought the decor was nice and relatively modern. The front desk staff were courteous and responded very well to my few routine requests. As expected the room was small, and there was just enough room on the small table next to the tv for my laptop and a small book, which was fine for me. Overall the room was clean but there were a few stray hairs left in the bathroom. The wireless for $10 worked well for routine internet use and email. The heating unit was on the wall, and worked fine. It was a bit noisy on the highest setting, but fine on low and medium. There was no thermostat which wasn't ideal but not a big problem. The location was very convenient and that was the main reason I booked the room. There wasn't any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: OttoCal
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Strathcona years ago and loved the convenient location and reasonable rate, so for a recent trip to Toronto for a Concert at Air Canada Centre I dug up the info so that we could check it out again. I remembered it being sort of old-fashioned, but that we couldn't beat the combination of good rate & location. By checking out the website, we discovered that the hotel has been undergoing tons of renovations. We choose a renovated queen room- not at the suite level, but the level up from the basic renovated room. We loved the modern decorations and touches. The room was small, but certainly not the smallest we have seen, and it did have a work area. They gave us a bag with waters and snacks when we checked in, which was nice. Parking in Toronto is always a challenge and often expensive. The underground garage is so vast that you could come out blocks away from the hotel entrance, so pay attention! We loved being in walking distance to the ACC, CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame and plenty of shopping. We also used the metro system, once we figured it out. The routes were easy enough, but we had a bit of trouble at first since we went into the rail station instead of the subway station. Oops. Toronto is an incredible bargain compared to NYC. This is Canada's largest city- rooms in Manhattan in a similar central location and with a similar quality would be about 3 times the price. So for some big city fun without the big city prices, give the Strathcona a try. We will use this hotel again. You can spend more money in Toronto at some of the better-known hotels or major chains, but we didn't feel the need- this is a better location than some of the chains, and we were happy with the price and value at Strathcona. Note-the pub in the lower level of the hotel did not stay open as late as advertised- and closed while there were people still in it. So we didn't get to try the pub or restaurant. We felt safe in the area, and also often used the underground walkways and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Central, Compact, Clean”
Reviews.Author: cameragrrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room (two bed) on the 6th floor. The beds were twin-sized, and yes the room was fairly compact. But really, not uncomfortably small at all (just, maybe smaller than what some travelers would be used to from a higher class of hotel). Our room faced the the back alley, so no view and not a lot of natural light, but even the rooms with a 'view' would just be overlooking the business-district buildings across the street, nothing fancy. Everything seemed clean/new/well-maintained from the lobby to the bathrooms. One thing: There was a spartan selection of toiletries, only a teeny-tiny shampoo, a tiny soap bar, and an even smaller facial soap bar (not enough for two female friends to share, for sure!). There appeared to be a decent restaurant onsite, though it was closed the week I was there for the holidays. Tim Hortons across the street. Right near two train stations, and within easy walking distance to most major sites (notably the Harborfront Center, and CN Tower). We got a great deal through Orbitz for about $65/night, which is a great deal. Not sure what they normally charge, but felt like we were getting a lot for what we were paying. Parking was conveniently located right next door, and it seemed like there were at least 2 or 3 other lots within a few blocks' walk (cost about $60 additional for 3 nights, but had no choice since no street parking or hotel lot was available).

Reviews.Title: “A Frat House with Clueless Staff”
Reviews.Author: motiongrafix
Reviews.Content: The room was an 'economy' and was clean if a bit Spartan. The problem came with the staff, who told a friend that I was NOT staying there when they called (ruining a planned outing.) The other tenants were mostly students who checked in with their alcohol. Late at night I saw a staffer trying to scrub blood off the front of my room's door. The fighters had also bled in the elevator. I'd recommend just about any other hotel over this one; there are plenty of better ones to choose from in Toronto. Just about all this hotel has to recommend it is its location.

Reviews.Title: “classic pub downstairs...”
Reviews.Author: travelcato
Reviews.Content: The Strath is well located.. it has a classic pub.. Classic in the sense the waiters have been around forever.. and i think they still serve Molson 50 on tap!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and of a high quality”
Reviews.Author: olaopa
Reviews.Content: Back at April My husband and I were staying at the Strathcona Hotel for three days. As he is a very busy man I had to arrange our journey but I didn't have a clue about Toronto, so I simply started searching for some information on the net and eventually I booked our room through a web site called Easy Click which offered a lot of information about the city. The price seemed very good and the location too so I just booked it. It was a good choice, cheap and at the same time of a high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: JStebs
Reviews.Content: Very impressed. Very clean, hallways smelled good, service at the counter was pleasant to deal with. They extended our stay (late checkout), and did not charge for fridge (no reason, they just said no cost to you). This was the only hotel I ever stayed at that had liquid hand and body wash as opposed to mini soaps (loved the smell of the body wash and prefered them over the soap). Only downfall is the rooms were small. Food at the downstairs pub was good. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful...”
Reviews.Author: GirlFromMay
Reviews.Content: The room was a blockhouse. No view (a wall right befire the window), no air, no heat. Depressing and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: bfranco01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two days. The staff was friendly. My only complaints would be the elevators did not always work, and a party they had over that weekend in the lobby area, it was very difficult to make it through the crowd and to the elevators. It was very odd that they would hold a party in the lobby of the hotel, they had very loud music and was packed with people. If I had been an invited guest it would have been different but otherwise the location was innapropriate. The room was clean, no complaints about it being dirty or anything. Had a nice flat screen and the view was of the downtown area. I would recommend the hotel, especially for it's price. BTW the pub next door (basement entrance), was very good and great priced. We had a great dinner, portions were HUGE and the beers were great. The price was great for the amount of food we got.

Reviews.Title: “Location "Absolutely Sublime"”
Reviews.Author: billy-the-cheater
Reviews.Content: 1. The Strathcona is right in the heart of Toronto. Everything was at hand 2. I am used to the European Hotel of "getting the arm in" for a safe deposit box. Therefore it was a great enhancement that the safe deposit box was pro bono 3. The staff and the concierge was more than helpful. Well done & thank you 4. The rooms were lovely & clean & well maintained over our four night stay 5. The rooms were bijou, however we were comfortable because my wife & I are slim. If you are a disgusting big rotund(s); either lose weight or get another hotel 6. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JaneCatLady
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona is a reasonably priced hotel, convenient to Union Station, the subway etc. I stayed for one night in order to attend the opera, and the hotel was OK. Breakfast was available in a restaurant off the lobby, and some of the food was not hot (eg. sausages). However it was bitterly cold out and every building seemed to be struggling to keep warm. I would (and probably) stay at the Strathcona again because the price is right, it's quiet enough, and there were no major annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, nice hotel, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: malloryll
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Strathcona after a very long road trip was pleasantly surprising. As we booked the hotel solely based on location, we had no idea what to expect, but it was very nice. The room, however, was very very small, which might be because of its location and lack of space, but it was livable. Since we spent most of out time in Toronto out on the town, the size of the room really didn't end up mattering. The walls were very thin, and my colleagues got a noise complaint for talking at normal volume. The beds were on wheels, which is a bit strange because they would roll around. The breakfast buffet was WAY overpriced and consisted of soggy eggs, inedible sausage, pastries, muffins and the like, so do NOT go to their breakfast buffet. Overall it was a nice stay, and the hotel itself is very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good locations, horrible parking situation and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: HollySnapSnap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and a great deal if you can get the $69 CAN room I did. However, plan to park up to five blocks away, since this hotel does not have parking. The night I stayed there were many events and concerts going on downtown and all the parking garages in the vicinity were full. My boyfriend had to drop me off and we paid $16 to park five blocks away from the hotel. When we checked in at 11pm, the only two people on staff were extremely overwhelmed with requests from guests and were quite short with everyone. The room was nice and clean and I'd consider staying again but only with better parking. If you don't have a vehicle this is a great location and a nice place but do not pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room....not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ss08
Reviews.Content: I too was deceived by their pictures on the web, our room was the size of a postage stamp, walls very thin, could plainly hear people in the other rooms, and in the halls. First room there was a family with a young baby, we could hear the crying as if it was in our room, I've had my kids, not interested in hearing others crying through the night. We were moved to another room after sharing our concern, thankfully! Phoned the front desk for a towel...never did come up. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not worth the full price”
Reviews.Author: CanuckV
Reviews.Content: If I had paid full price for this room, I would have been incredibly annoyed. The website shows beautiful, spacious, trendy rooms. Ours was very small and sparsely decorated, albeit clean. The staff was not especially helpful. They did nothing when I mentioned that we were disappointed in our room. They also charge you for wireless internet - an amenity that is most often free in even the diviest of places. We were woken up one morning by a fire alarm and once the firefighters left, the staff just watched as the guests wandered around trying to get into the locked stairways to get back to bed. No one directed anyone during this fire drill. There is a restaurant attached the the hotel, but guests get nothing for this (no discount or complimentary continental breakfast). Location is great and rooms were clean, but you can find much better value (and deals) in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, well-kept rooms,and a central downtown location”
Reviews.Author: NZholidayOttawa
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I took our elderly parents for a special visit to Toronto on Labour Day weekend and we stayed at the Strathcona Saturday night. Your staff recognized an "over-booking problem" that required a change in our planned accommodation at your hotel, and promptly made suitable changes for us. Your hotel is very well-kept and comfortable, and the friendly and accommodating attitude of all the staff we met was exemplary. Thank you for helping us to make the weekend very enjoyable for our parents. The Strathcona will be our first choice for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Great location- but that's as far as it goes!”
Reviews.Author: atlas2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights early on in August 2009. I arrived at the hotel in the very early hours of the morning to exceptionally loud music and an empty reception desk. The office that was attached to the desk was open and there were no staff members to be seen! I eventually found the receptionist in the dining room. He said; "You should have knocked" to which I asked where exactly?! The room was a good enough size, clean but the air conditioning unit was exceptionally noisy so could not be used through the evening. The following morning I approach the reception desk to enquire about a safety deposit box. A senior staff member, who was on the phone gestured to her colleague who had limited English to meet me at the side door- the office was secure at this stage, unlike yesterday evening. I was given a label with a security number and I was led to believe that my belongings (credit card, passport etc) would be put in a safe and when I wished to obtain them again I would need to submit the aforementioned security label and my belongings would be given to me. The following day I approached the desk and was asked, with a perplexed look where my key was. It transpires that the Strathcona DO have individual safety deposit boxes but my belongings had just been left on the side of the unsecure office all evening. Thankfully, everything was there but I was not amused! The hotel do say that you receive a complimentary newspaper every morning (you actually pay) but I did not receive one for the three days I was there. I was not aware of this complimentary service until I departed! In short, this hotel appears to be content with its location, service doesn't seem to matter. You should be aware though that the Strathcona is not alone in its location, there are several other hotels in the area and if I returned to Toronto (which incidentally is a great city!) I would stay in alternate accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Pairc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Strathcona for one night in August. Location is great, expecially if you are coming to see a baseball game. The rooms are small and small rooms don't usually bother me but this room was dark and dull. We were glad we were just staying for one night. I think we stayed in a queen so maybe you could get a bigger room as this hotel is in a great location. We got charged $10 dollars for internet

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: JaaMa
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Everything worked, my room was clean and in order. Hotel lobby was nice and staff friendly. Location was very good. I especially liked the fact that the Express Airport bus left 10m from the hotel doors as did a bus trip to Niagra falls. Union station is also about 50m away. Basic turist attractions were close like CN Tower and Rogers stadium just to name a few. Shopping was good and within a walking distance. Good restaurant street like Baldwin St. wasn't too far away though it takes about 20 min. to walk there. I definetely recommend this street, really good food from all around the globe! One down side; internet in the hotel lobby was rather expensive but if you have you laptop internet was free. I booked this hotel through Hotwire and it was well worth of my money. Wouldn't mind staying in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kanada82
Reviews.Content: This is probably the smallest hotel room Ive ever slept in. We found the room on hotwire, and chose this hotel over another similarly-priced as it was advertised as boutique. Boutique would be a stretch of the definition here. The room was so small that we couldnt add a cot. Dont stay here if youre looking for a view or amenities. Otherwise, price was good, and location fantastic. Parking in the lot next door was actually a great deal - I think it was 23CAD from Friday afternoon to Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not-too-OK staffs”
Reviews.Author: MR42
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel 3 star to make it "Average" if their staffs can show more hospitality and provide better services. The location is good. The room is not big but acceptable and clean. No fridge, which is not convenient. Wall is paper thin so beware you'd be woke up when your neighbor takes a shower. With all these aside, we're most annoyed by the staffs of this hotel. Not that they made big mistakes or offend us in anyway, but they just didn't make you feel very welcomed, which is bad if you're in a gotel/service business. They'd act business-like & professional but what they did are not--we booked 2 nights but when checking in they say it's 1 night; we asked about parking rates for nearby garage they gave us incorrect rates; we asked for street bus pass info they again gave wrong price; and when asked about "you offer free internet service?" we got a "r u kidding me" face telling us OF COURSE you have to pay for it. Since our previous stop we stayed in a 4-star hotel with excellent staff & free/fast wireless internet & we didn't pay too much more than we paid for Strathcona, we cannot feel too good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nctrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strathcona while attending a conference. We got a great deal on Hotwire and upgraded our room for a reasonable price. The check in was very quick. The rooms are very clean and allergy free....no carpets, no curtains (blinds) and no bedspreads (rather crisp sheets covering a duvet). The room is small, but very quiet. It is very close to Union Station and within walking distance to most attractions. There are restaurants and coffee shops close by. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but pack earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Jacer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 750 yards from the St Lawrence market and the lakefront; 500 yards from the CN tower, Rogers stadium and the Eaton Centre; Union Station is just across the road - so great location for everything, but boy is the traffic never-ending and noisy! The hotel itself is clean, well equipped and the staff are excellent. But the star employee is Alex, the concierge, who is a gold mine of information and assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but tiny room - wouldn't have been good for more than a night”
Reviews.Author: SJS15
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel in downtown Toronto but the room was tiny and had minute windows. It was fine for a one night stop over en route from Niagara Falls to Toronto Airport for a flight west. For more than a night the room would have been too small for too of us. But the plus side is it is fairly close to bus tours around the city, the CN Tower and the great waterfront. And the front desk was really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: Cathal M
Reviews.Content: It is in a location for all the attractions CN Tower is only a few streets/blocks away, the Harbour front again is only a 10-15 minute walk. The hotel was ok the rooms however or not as described or pictured on their websites. The maids are a bit lazy as the only empty the bins and only change the bed linen and towels when you ask for it even though they are meant to every three days. The key cards are abit of a disaster as it can take a few trys to open the door The hotel is a bit pricey for what it offers and the rooms it is at most a 2/3 star hotel ok if you only want a place to crash or put your head down at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perect location for the right price”
Reviews.Author: tylerb83
Reviews.Content: I reserved this room using an online booking company and paid around $100 per night (including taxes and fees for 2 rooms, 2 nights). So the price was right. Regarding location, the hotel is smashed between 3 subway stops and is a few steps from the Entertainment District, and is a short walk to the CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, Union Station, Yonge St, St. Lawrence Market, and Harbourfront. Easy access via York St. from Gardiner Expressway. Regarding the room and hotel itself, I can't think of anything negative to say given the circumstances of our trip. I (and my family) visited Toronto to see the city, not enjoy lavish hotel amenities. The room was cozy, had one double bed (more like queen-sized), was clean and well-maintained, and had a great view of York and Wellington from the 6th floor. The staff were helpful in helping us find things to do and were kind. Lastly, regarding parking... the hotel does not have a parking garage - but that's quite okay. Many downtown Toronto hotels charge anywhere from $18-32 per night based on my searches. Heading north on York, the entrance to the underground garage (lot 52; 40 York St.) is just before the front door of the hotel on the left. I just pulled into the entrance, family members unloaded, and I parked. It's true, the pedestrian entrance to the garage is about 1 block (2 is stretching it) to the hotel entrance. Parking, from Friday afternoon until Sunday afternoon cost $38 CAN, which averages to $19 per night - a very fair price considering other hotel garages. Keep in mind that parking is typically cheaper on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated, great location, affordable”
Reviews.Author: keithoflondon
Reviews.Content: I was attending a converence at the University of Toronto. I booked the Strathcona because I took VIA rail to the city. The Strathcona is located so close to Union Station, the subway, and the wonderful beneath-the-city shops that begin at the Royal York and move north. I had one day to shop before the conference began. The Strathcona has been completely renovated. The rooms are small (think Paris small), but well air-conditioned. The bed was very comfortable. There was desk, great lighting, a closet, dresser, iron and ironing board. The floor was hardwood and totally dust free. The bathroom was spotless. The room lacked nothing. My only complaint was that a wake up call was not made on the second morning I was staying there. I was annoyed and received an apology. The cafe has a good reputation and there is a steak house attached. The restaurant also has a basement pub, but there are so many great restaurants close by, I didn't go to these eating places. Stay at the Strathcona if what you are wanting is value for your money and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: v_rol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights recently - got a good deal through Hotels.com with 30%. We booked a Deluxe Queen room - nothing outstanding about it, smallish rooms, but just what I expected - adequate and clean. We were on the 3rd floor on the front of the hotel. Well this room was very noisy with the street traffic etc so the next morning we asked for a higher floor or one at the back of the hotel. We were complimentary upgraded to a better room on the 7th floor which was a nicer room and much quieter - so I recommend asking for the highest floor possible! Breakfast was expensive - can recommend Shopsey's which is a couple of blocks away (past Union Station) much cheaper and a really great breakfast! We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the standard of the food. Good location for all the main attractions, especially the CN tower and harbour front. All in all a pleasant stay at the Strathcona.

Reviews.Title: “Really nothing special go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mkguyukBucks
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights. Staff very indifferent and lacked any warmth. Rooms very small which I knew in advance but lacked any good design features (mind you don't hit your head whilst cleaning your teeth !! and my "deluxe" room faced a wall. The adjoining pub was souless and the restaurant attached offered poor value for money. The location was first class but if I were you, I would look at another hotel in the same location. This hotel was a big disappointment on what was a fantastic city break.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - Rather Basic for the price”
Reviews.Author: Aprilbloom63
Reviews.Content: I booked a Deluxe Room which to be honest was worse than Basic Rooms i have stayed in, in other Hotels. Buffet Breakfast was expensive and we ate at other places. Pub was fine though if you like watching Sport. Ideal location though for Attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, pity about the service!”
Reviews.Author: baileyOT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to explore the city! Was really great. We visited most places on foot. The room was tiny but clean. Bed was comfortable but unfortunately the walls appear to be paper thin. We were woken up both nights by groups of people coming home hammered in the middle of the night. When we left on Saturday night after we arrived we told them at reception that our toilet was blocked. They said that they would sort it out but when we returned at 3am the toilet was still blocked. It was an uncomfortable night! They did fix it the next day, but i really think it's appauling that the didn't fix it instantly. If it wasn't for that I probably would have given them a much higher rating. Over all the hotel was fine, the room was small but the location makes up for it. It is perfect just as a base to sleep to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well placed”
Reviews.Author: vanderwal
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 night stay at the Strathcona and it was quite comfortable, clean, but rooms a little on the small side & did not have a desk to work at. While there was a $10 charge for WiFi it was steady and relatively quick. I was out of the hotel for most of the day for work and meetings so the lack of desk & size was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, we'll return”
Reviews.Author: sweeties97
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice - once for leisure, and once for a nearby convention. Both times the rooms have been small, but well equipped with a good bed and reasonable amenities. It's an old hotel, so we take along our ear plugs just in case, but haven't needed them. We have been fortunate when we asked for rooms away from the elevator/stairs. The staff have been very helpful with our few requests and last time let us into the room in the morning because it was available. The hotel had made some nice practical and attractive changes to the room we were in this time (they are in the process of redecorating I think). The bathroom was clean and attractive. The bedroom was small but attractively furnished and with good design and use of available space. We had a conference at the Convention Centre one day - a five minute walk - and at the King Eddy the next day - a seven minute walk - and close to the entertainment district with lots of restaurants to choose from. Hard to beat it - all in all a great location, great value.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location and price--good deal”
Reviews.Author: dgw9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 211 at the Strathcona Hotel in Toronto on April 6th & 7th, 2009. We were in town to watch the Detroit Tigers and the Toronto Blue Jays at the Rogers Centre. I saw that someone had used Skoosh.com to get a good room rate. Using Skoosh, we got two nights for 134.00 (U.S) total including all taxes. That rate beat all the other travel sites by at least 10 percent. The room was small--not much bigger than our bedroom--and there is no view to speak of unless you like looking at air-conditioning systems on a rooftop. But the room was clean and pretty quiet. The staff was efficient and courteous and we didn't have any problems. The location is just great--1/2 a mile or less to Rogers Centre, convenient to Spadina, Yonge, Front St, King, and Queen streets. Tim Hortons and a newspaper shop right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Return!”
Reviews.Author: Maritimer_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Strathcona, and we would certainly return. While our room was small, it was clean, and the shower produced a pressure to awaken anyone; the staff was courteous and helpful (checked us in an hour early, and stored our luggage on the morning of our departure); and the price was right, especially considering the location. If you're happy at a hotel that produces the basic amenities and considerate, professional service, you'll be happy at the Strathcona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyMOttawa
Reviews.Content: This place is located right center to all the places we wanted to see. My friend and I went to see a concert and when I called to book they were the only hotel I found who did not talk down to you about not owning a credit card. They are in walkin distance from the train station, the cn tower, hockey hall of fame and the AC and the rogers center. It was amazing and being that we were first timers in a hotel they didn't make ya feel like any question was too stupid. I am going back to toronto and I am staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “A 5-Star, 2-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: French_Viking
Reviews.Content: I've stayed four times at the Strathcona over the last few months. The location cannot be beat - across the street from Union Station; a couple of blocks East is the financial core, Hockey Hall of Fame and the "start" of Younge Street; a couple of blocks West is Roy Thomson Hall, ACC, CN Tower and the theatre district; a couple of blocks North(ish) is the Eaton Centre and (a little further North from there) is the posh Bloor/Bay area. It is that central a hotel. They are in the process of updating the rooms and have stayed in both the "old" rooms and the "new" ones. The (only) difference I've noticed between the two is that the carpets have been replaced by laminate flooring. Otherwise, the rooms have been more or less identical in terms size and furnishings. (I'm sure the bathrooms were updated in an earlier phase as every "old" and "new" room I've stayed in has had the same modern-ish, simple appointments in them.) What I find too bad with the "new" rooms is that those little finishing details lacking in the "old" rooms were not fixed. With either room, it is not uncommon to find a bad patch job (or two) on the ceiling, a few scuff marks on the walls (sometimes quite large), somewhat sloppy paint jobs on the door/window trims, a few uneven wallpaper joints, etc. I realise these are all minor things, but considered together, they do (negatively) impact your impressions of the room. That being said, the bathrooms and bedding have always been spotless... and I am very picky about this. (To give you an idea, I'm the type to meticulously inspect the bathtub/toilet/sink for any stray hairs and/or dirt and always take apart the bed to check for the same (and any signs of bed bugs).) One note on the bedding, don't expect pillow-top matresses, down comforters and fluffy pillows. You get very average matresses and pillows (but still comfortable enough) and beds made up of a think polyester blanket "wrapped" in two flat sheets to give the bed a "sleek" look. The bottom line is that if you are looking for a clean, basic, ultra-convenient hotel for a very fair price, this is your place. This is not your place if you want even a hint of luxury and comfort. The times that I have stayed, I have gotten really great rates (i.e., $120 CAD per night, all taxes in) which has kept me coming back. If ever I was to get higher rates, I would likely stay at other near-by options (e.g., Metropolitain Toronto, Cosmopolitain) that offer superior quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: DutchBishop
Reviews.Content: I think the people who write bad reviews of this hotel are the kind who "expect a cadillac for a chevrolet price". I booked this hotel online for $72 a night. For that I got a very clean hotel with a courteous professional staff in the center of downtown Toronto. Yes, my room was small (think Microtel-size) with only a bed, two end tables, and a tv stand. But it was very clean, nice, and adequate for my means. The hotel location is great, only a block from Union Station, the underground walkway, subway, and a couple of blocks from the stadium. If there is more than one person in your party, however, I would check with the hotel first and tell them how many people you have. They may have some larger rooms that would hold 3 or 4 people as opposed to my room which was adequate for 1-2 people but no more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Few Amenities”
Reviews.Author: visitsoon21
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at www.allhotels.com and highly recommend this site. I give this hotel 50% because for every positive there is a negative. Nothing is included with the price of the room. The hotel does not have a pool, or parking, or comforters for the beds. They charge a lot for internet AND local calls. I have stayed here twice and both times had to call down for extra blankets both times. The hotel rooms ARE very small but are very well kept and comfortable. I also like the bathrooms except that both times our bathroom did not have a fan or window. The TV is not very large in the room and not great quality. The heater/A/C in the room does not have temperature control, so if you turn on the heat it will heat alllll night and you'd have to get up to turn it off. The hotel staff are accommodating and helpful. I'm really not sure if we will stay here again or try somewhere else from now on. The price is reasonable for downtown and its close to everything including the harbor and all sorts of dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rcan58
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto for a short break good hotel, the staff are Friendly and helpful Small rooms but nicely renovated and clean Stay here for the location could not be in a better place for CN Tower, Rogers centre, union station and Young street which has everything you need for a great stay. we had breakfast in the hotel which was very good.will stay here again when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: This is a small well-located hotel across from the much better known Royal York Hotel. This is a safe, clean, convenient economical place to stay for a night in downtown Toronto. The rooms are tiny, so for an extended stay, a person will probably will want to try elsewhere. Note that there is no onsite fitness facilities, but the luxurious and very well-regarded Wellington Club is very close and $10 will get you a pass to the Club. The hotel is a short walk from Union Station and close to St. Andrew's Subway Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lou4406
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, only minutes from the CN Tower, Rogers centre, union station and Young street which has everything you need for a great stay. The rooms where a bit small but had everything you need, the Pub at the hotel is very nice and the staff are very helpful. I would recommend the hotel and if I go back to Toronto I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Deekny
Reviews.Content: We found this property last minute via sidestep.com which sent us to Skoosh.com Booked it for $60.USD plus tax. We were going to a concert at the Air Canada Center and this hotel was within walking distance. The hotel does not have its own parking lot, but there was a very reasonable parking lot right next door for $14.00 overnight. They are in the process of renovating the property and we did get a newly appointed room. It's boutique style. Small but very comfortable rooms. For the price we were very happy. Be aware...our view was into another room..which the occupants put on a very explicit show...funny how folks just don't care who they show off too...so we just closed our blinds.. All and all, we'd definitely stay here again without a worry. Staff was efficient at checking in and they have a concierge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: lostalot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel about 4 years ago and it was good value then - we returned recently for a single nights stay to note that it has now been renovated with a fresher and more contemporary atmosphere making it a most pleasant base to explore the city. As per several other reviews, I agree that the rooms are smaller than in other Toronto hotels but are well decorated, warm, clean and well appointed - our room was more than adequate for two people. Our stay was improved further by the pleasant, helpful reception and concierge staff and the courteous service at breakfast.. Situated directly across from the airport express bus stop and round the corner from the main railway station, excellently positioned for all downtown tourist sites and within easy walking distance of pubs, cafes and restaurants - what else do you need at rates that are much lower than many other Toronto establishments. We enjoyed this hotel during our short stay and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM”
Reviews.Author: brentiesuk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for out last night in Toronto after travelling back from Niagara and I have got to say this was more impressive than the Oakes in Niagara for which we had paid considerablely more money !!!. Friendly , polite and efficient check in staff . The rooms are not the biggest however they are very tastelully furnished and are immaculately clean. The location of the hotel is superb and I would highly recommend booking. We only stayed here one night and our flight was not until the following night - we left our luggage and valuables at the hotel during our last day (free of charge !!) and booked their own limo service to the airport - which like the hotel was very efficient and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap as chips but not without quality”
Reviews.Author: Belfast_N_Ireland_
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in downtown Toronto. It's quiet yet there's clubs if you want (the closing time in Canada is pretty early for bars at least), there're shops nearby but it's not in the middle of a mecca, and if you're looking to visit the CN Tower this is an ideal location for a 5 minute walk. Granted it's not in the 'trendy' (i.e expensive) or shopping districts of Toronto but it's a stones throw away.... and means there's not loads of people walking around at all times. It's very very handy to the train station and all the local/tourist bus routes. The hotel looks a bit rough around the edges from the outside, but the inside is great. And truthfully, we'd all rather it looked rough outside a hotel than inside it! The rooms are small but they have air conditioning - a bit noisy but nothing to fret over and they are extremely clean, with maid service daily. Plus they're very tastefully decorated! Finally, the staff are extremely friendly. It doesn't matter what time of night/day it is, or how stupid the question is - they've got the answers! I know we all say this, but if I'm ever in Toronto again I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “small room noisy air con”
Reviews.Author: rubybellissimo
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have identified my gripes. The room was standard class and very small. I would not operate the air con because it was too noisy. Preferred stale air. I was glad it was only for one night in this hotel. Staff were very nice. I chose this hotel because it was one block to Via Rail station. The breakfast (included in my price) was Outstanding. I booked on the hotel website and thought the room was a bit expensive for what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small ROoms”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: 2 Blocks from Union Station (train station), right downtown. Rooms are small, but clean. Checkin smooth.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelly388
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive room so cannot coment about the standard rooms. Hotel in Brilliant location, room had huge confortable king size bed clean and tidy room, for the price and the star rating thought it was a really good hotel. Not a luxury hotel but as was only using for a base was perfect as not much time spent in room. Hotel staff were friendly and helpfull and there are phones and computers that can be used in the loby. The executive room was only about Â£10 more a night so would recommend the upgrade so you can stay in a budget hotel but in a nicer room type Would deff recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Y! This place is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: jeffbro
Reviews.Content: Dreadful experience of staying only one night in this hotel. To be sure, this stay was the worst business hotel experience I've ever had, the world over, and that is no exaggeration by any means. They should be ashamed to operate such sub-standard facilities at incongruently over-priced rates. Most importantly to me, as a result of the substandard conditions of my so called 'executive room', I had an exceedingly poor sleep of less than six hours, all before important meetings for which I needed to be rested. For some reason, there is an emergency light power box fixed to the wall above the desk in the room. This device emits a constant green glow from a diode. That would be tolerable if it were not for the incessant and irregularly strobe like brilliantly red light that flashes from this box, all night long; over, and over, and over again, like a taunting irritant. Turns out, this box does not even need to be here! Hotel administration acknowledge it shouldn't be there and should have been installed in the outside hallway, which it serves! To bad they didn't fix this before renting the room, even though they acknowledge it as one of the many problems with the room. Coupled with this, however, was the constant and grossly disruptive street, hall and adjoining room noise which passed through the door, windows and walls as if they were paper. Indeed, though I was on the ninth floor, the street noise was incomprehensibly loud. Through the room door, which is immediately across from the stairwell door, which I can attest is frequently used, came the constant noise of people opening and closing the stairwell door, which slams shut very loudly, reverberating disruptive noise through the room. Listening to the showers of adjoining room occupants above and adjacent to this room was less than appealing too. Not being able to rest fitfully, I got up to work in the night. Perhaps not surprisingly, the light over the desk would not work, and the desk lamp was inadequate for laptop working. The TV was an antiquated relic and the signal very poor at best. The bathroom was shameful, with a sink right out of the Don Jail, a lovely patch on the ceiling and patches on the walls, and the shower head falling from the wall. The size of the entire room was not much larger than a walk-in closet. All in all, and needless to say, it was less than a restful or pleasant stay. One would think the high speed wireless internet would be available with the room as a courtesy, but instead was evidently only available for fee. Rather than incurring what was likely a disproportionate expense, given my experience with the room, I passed on this service so can't comment. To be sure, the room price was very disproportionate to the quality, or lack thereof, of the room in general. I was exceedingly disappointed, and tired after my stay. The host's response was one of surprise in that she noted I was in an 'executive room'. I agree with her that the experience does not comport with the standards of an executive room. But when she suggested I should have called to change rooms, my only response is that their rooms should all meet a minimum standard, and if this room, being bad as it was, was permitted to exist in this condition, then my concern was 'how bad might the next room be?' As a courtesy, these concerns were brought to the hotel administrations' attention, and they concede a number of concerns existed without their knowledge (why wouldn't they inspect the room before charging such high rates?! They could have addressed the problems in advance, but didn't.), and in respect of other concerns, they're currently renovating to address those (then why continue to rent the pre-renovated rooms at such high rates!!, or why not put customers in the renovated rooms!!). To me, their response of acknowledging the substandard conditions, but offering only a future free night's stay in a room which should have been given in the first place. One would think a refund of some small measure would be more appropriate. I won't go back, and take this time to share my experience so no one else falls into the same trap I did, of thinking 'you get what you pay for' and the high price reflected quality; it did not.

Reviews.Title: “Alwlays A Charmer!”
Reviews.Author: StCreek
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! That is number one. It couldn't be in a better place in Toronto for getting around to everything. The rooms are a bit small but CLEAN. Each time we stay, have stayed over eight times, the rooms are immaculate. The staff always helpful. The best is if you travel with VIA Rail you get a discount. What a bonus...and the station is just down the block. Will always stay here when we come to Toronto just cannot beat the location and the absolute cleanliness of this boutique type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: heartofaragorn
Reviews.Content: Great location, as it is about 1 mile from the CN Tower and in the heart of downtown (near an entrance to PATH, as well). However, parking is difficult to locate and very expensive, and for the price paid, the room was a huge disappointment. The lobby was stunning, so expectations about the room wwere high. But the decor was nonexistent, the beds were singles, the bathroom was barely large enough to turn around in. But it was clean and the location was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK hotel if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: mtl_chick_08
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for a night in this hotel. I tried to get the VIA Rail discount when I made the reservation but luckily I got a lower rate by calling directly the hotel. We paid 175 CAD total for a 2 bed room. The location is the best you can get in Toronto, very close to Union Station (metro and train station to move around), the theaters, CN Tower, Rogers Center. There are several places to eat around, you could have breakfast at Tim Hortons across street or Second Cup just in the corner. Our room was nice, clean and big enough for the 4 of us. The beds are very comfortable, the bathroom was ok too...the only minor complain here is that the carpet in the room didn't look clean. During our stay only one elevator was working, we were in a high floor and we had to wait over 10 minutes to go downstairs when we were checking out...that was quite annoying. Internet connection is NOT included, I asked for it and you have to pay 15 CAD extra per day... not a good deal. If you get a good nightly rate for this hotel it is a good place to stay. I would not pay more than 190 CAD to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “OK at the Strathcona”
Reviews.Author: Bigcolw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights. The bus from the airport drops you off right round the corner from the hotel, so not too far to walk. Found some of the reception staff to be lacking personality and basic manners but this wasn't a just a Strathcona thing, however it's disappointing after a lengthy flight. Rooms are small and a tight squeeze with all your luggage but they are well equipped and clean. Didn't try the breakfast out as there's a Tim Horton's right across the road. The bar in the basement lacks sparkle as most hotel bars do, but the staff are friendly and the food is reasonable but basic. You can walk easily anywhere, Union Station, Yonge Street, Water front, CN tower and the area is financial so it feels clean and safe to walk. If the price is right I would recommend this hotel, we paid 55GBP. Don't ask for another filter coffee for your room as they only allow you one a day, stingy lot.

Reviews.Title: “A nice basic hotel - ideal for exploring Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Niawynp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Strathcona last September (2007). It definately is a basic hotel, but the staff are great, the rooms are clean and it is in an ideal location for anyone wanting to explore Toronto. I would definately stay there again. One tip is to avoid the breakfast and hop over the road to Tim Hortons and pick up something there - much cheaper than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Perfect, Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Jax
Reviews.Content: I really can not fault the Strathcona hotel! The location is amazing, right in the heart of everything, with fantastic transport links to anywhere you may want to visit - the train station is literally at the end of the road. The rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated and incredibly clean. The rooms are made up promptly and with thought every day (the maid would arrange our PJs in different patterns every day - a really cute touch!) You have wonderful wooden blinds that block out any noise and light, and the aircon - if a little noisy - is powerful and provides welcome relief from the heat! You have your own cute wardrobe and all the ammenities you could possibly need for your stay. The toiletries smell of lemongrass...mmm! We didnt have breakfast included in our room rate - but right across the road is an underground food court, with all the normal amazing Canadian things..Tim Hortons etc! 7/11 is just up the road for an even cheaper snack! Admittedly, was a little suprised to receive a fairly conservative reception on our arrival - then to find the receptionists falling over themselves when we were glammed up later that night for a meal at the CN tower (which is just 5 mins walk away!) But by the end of the week, they were smiling and welcoming, so it's not a real issue. If you want a high-class stay at mid-class prices, stay in the Strathcona Hotel!! You wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Been back several times”
Reviews.Author: sing13star
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have a cottage about 90 minutes east of Toronto, so we wanted to find accommodations for overnights in Toronto. We first chose the Strathcona because it was affordable and within walking distance of the train station. Although the rooms are small, we have always encountered friendly service and clean facilities. We think the dining room is somewhat overpriced and slow (prefer Tim Horton across the street for breakfast), but the pub downstairs is very pleasant. The food is amazingly good and the service friendly. As older folks, we prefer to eat an early dinner and don't want a huge meal, so this suits us fine. This is a business-like hotel, not a resort in which to lounge or luxuriate, but is perfectly adequate for our needs. We will definitely be back again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal”
Reviews.Author: AndrewKat
Reviews.Content: So to preface this review: yes the hotel was cheap, and yes the location is great. That being said, we were three men booking a room with 2 beds and a cot. It was like this was the first time this request has ever been made, because we had to be moved twice thanks to the tiny, tiny, little rooms. The first room was really small, had two single beds, and a window that faced a wall. It was fairly clean, but had a goopy red stain on the wall (maybe blood, maybe ketchup - I don't know, and I don't want to think about it). The second room was a little larger, but was still deemed to be too small for a cot by the hotel staff. They moved us to a different floor into a room that was almost exactly the size of the second room. The cot fit in there, but just barely and it blocked the bathroom door and the tv (which incidentally was in the closet). It sat at the feet of the two single beds and didn't allow us to get to one of the beds without crawling over the other two. The window in this room looked out onto another wall and it appeared dark and rainy out, even though it was sunny and warm outside. All told, the rooms are really really small (at least the ones we were shown), but they are fairly clean. The bathrooms were fine, the location was great, the pub downstairs was nice. Would I stay again? Probably not, but if I was really in a pinch for cash, I'd think about it... maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Barongoal
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a nice hotel for under $100, the Strathcona is a very good choice. The location in downtown Toronto is perfect. Close to all attractions and not to far from many others. The hotel is very clean and gives you a good comfortable feeling. Very friendly and helpful staff. I will go back for sure my next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: MsFi
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night and have no complaints about the location, room or hotel facilities in general. Everything was clean comfortable and met my needs. But surly doesnt begin to describe the front desk staff I encountered. The man who checked me in was curt dismissive and unhelpful. Checkout next morning was similar. I had just endured a long train trip and a hint of friendliness would have gone a long way. Oh well....wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: donbo
Reviews.Content: After reading the few negative reviews on here my fiancee and I were a little hesitant to stay at the Strathcona..but..wow!!! from the moment we arrived until the very last second we left we were treated like royalty! The room was clean and wonderful in every way!The maid was there to tidy up daily and we were given fresh sheets,new glasses and toiletries for the full seven days we stayed! I am disabled with cerebral palsy but i was looked after in every way and treated with respect and dignity by the whole staff!I've travelled alot in my life as a musician and can honestly say that the Strathcona is among the best hotels in North America..and my fiancee is from Scotland and said it is on par with the best she has stayed at in the UK. The rooms are small but that isn't a problem as the whole idea of being in toronto is to be out and about. the location is perfect as it is in the heart of everything you would want to do.Tim Horton's is across the street,the Hockey Hall of Fame and the Air Canada Centre are within walking distance as well as many fine restaurants such as Jack Astor's(try the steak!) and shopsey's deli(excellent breakfasts for very little money) We will be back again often and are looking forward to spending more time with our new friends..the staff of the Strathcona!!

Reviews.Title: “comfy and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Fionnula
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have stayed at the Strathcona twice and plan to visit Toronto in March and May and have made arrangements to stay there once again. Although the room was small, it was very clean and comfortable. Our TV was not up on the ceiling, which was nice, hope this hasn't changed. I cannot comment on any other services or lack there of, as we did not require them. But all in all the Strathcona was very much to our liking. The complimentary breakfast had a wide variety of tasty choices and I had the most delicious lunch there. The staff are friendly and helpful It's very central, right across the street from the train station and right around the corner is the CN tower.

Reviews.Title: “Stratchonia Hotel Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: twilsonb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was a good price and walking distance to the Air Canada Centre (we went to a concert there). Small rooms but clean and a good price for downtown TO. We requested upper floors and had a nice view of downtown. It was cold but def walkable to the ACC and restaurants and bars. Would def stay there again. Checkin and checkout was fast and easy and accurate. The concerige was not as helpful as we would have liked giving crazy directions to parking and looked he was just there to "get paid" but thankfully we know our way around anyway.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: judywes
Reviews.Content: We booked the Strathcona for one night at the end of a four day train journey. The train was six hours late arriving in Toronto, so the conductor called the Strathcona to inform them we would not be arriving for our 6 p.m. reservation until 6 a.m. the next day. Not only did the Strathcona agree to our very late arrival, but they allowed us a late checkout (2:00 p.m.), which gave us time for a nap, a shower, and lunch before catching the 5:45 p.m. train to Niagara Falls. Their entire staff was helpful and friendly. Our room was attractive, immaculate, and comfortable. Because we arrived by train, we received a discount in the nightly rate. The hotel is located in the financial district, near the waterfront and Sky Tower, one block from the train depot, and five blocks from the shopping center. It's location was handy to everything. There is a small cafe that serves breakfast until 2:00 p.m. I highly recommend the Strathcona and their friendly, professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location - walikng distance from sports arenas”
Reviews.Author: Agentman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a two day business trip. Good central location and easy to get around. Hotel itself is fine for single traveller on business trip (exactly my description.) If you're planning on taking the family, BEWARE because are very small but in good, clean condition. Elevators need work since, depending on time of day, you waited forever for it to show up and I heard several other guests with the same complaint. As long as you're not planning on staying in your room much, this place is fine for a short in and out weekend trip.
