If you're a sports fan, the location is perfect as you can walk to either the Air Canada Centre or Rogers Centre (fka Sky Dome) One important tip: Taxis to and from the aiprort can be very pricey. I found the best bet was to take the aiport shuttle which you can catch right across the street at the Fairmont Royal York. It cost only $16.95 which is only about a 1/3 of the cost of a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Coldcuts
Reviews.Content: A great location is the only thing going for this hotel. Terrible customer service at the front desk from check in through check out. Food and drinks (that I never had) were charged to my room - whoever did it used my name and room number, and forged my signature - overall a very bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: scottishtraveller74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the strathcona for 3 nights and found the hotel to be very central and clean, some of the reviews are very misleading, I found the hotel staff to be polite and helpful not that we used them much as we were part of a tour. The hotel is less than 10 mins walk from the harbourfront, the CN Tower, Air Canada Centre and the Rogers Arena (better known as the Sky Dome), Our room was on the top floor and the view was not great and it could be quite noisy but due to the locality of the hotel we expected this, The air conditioning worked well. Overall I would say this hotel is a good clean well located hotel but a bit proce from the rates that were given in the room of about Â£120 British Pounds a night (room only)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: StudentinOttawa
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Strathcona Hotel for a weekend trip. While the location was ideal, and the breakfast that was included in the package was tasty, that's where the good things ended. Upon our arrival, we found out that they had over-booked the hotel. Despite having booked and confirmed my room by credit-card some months before, I was told that they would have to ship us to another downtown hotel that had room. I've never run into a problem like this before, and while the service staff were attempting to be accommodating, they were far from understanding. We had to get a taxi to a different hotel, and then argue with the staff at the different hotel about what accommodation we'd be getting. We had a number of items with us, that we didn't want to have to lug around Toronto. This is one of the reasons we actually booked a hotel for three days, and didn't choose to move from hotel to hotel. However, having been shipped to a different location, we were required to wait around for check-in on the next day at the Strathcona, so that we could put our things in our room and actually go out to our appointments. Due to late check-in at 3:00, and check-out at the other location at 11:00, we had to argue with both hotels to extend our time and wait in lobbies to ensure a continuous place to keep our things safe. Unfortunately, when we finally got our room one day later, the disappointments continued. The room was very tiny, and looked like it had been decorated in 1980. The tiny bathroom was its saving grace, which was quite tastefully decorated and had nice products for use. The air conditioning unit was noisy, and our view was of the wall of another office building about 5 metres away. While the staff at the front desk were friendly, during our final two days there, they did not make up for the inconveniences and inadequacies of the hotel itself. This hotel is too expensive for what you're getting. You'd be better off staying at the Comfort Inn and paying half the price. At least you'd be guaranteed a room!

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: AyrApple
Reviews.Content: i read all the reviews before my husband and i went to this hotel had some mixed feelings but found things to be okay rooms were okay everything we needed was there beds and pillows were great realy comfy we stayed here 5 nights had breakfast 4 of the days in hotel went out once for breakfast my advice have breakfast in hotel a few dollers more but worth it hot or cold buffet served with juice toast as much tea or coffee as u like at first i thought there was something wrong with the toilet as the water was half way up the pan as if blocked no all toilets r like this in canada realy enjoyed my stay and would go back again as it was also near everything we wanted to do

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: LLion
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona Hotel in Toronto was a good choice because of its proximity to the Metro Convention Center just two blocks away. It is centrally located and their are many restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. It is also close, about one block, from the main train station in Toronto. The Airport Express bus pickup site is just across the street. In addition, access to the subway is also quite close. There are several international ATM machines in close proximity of the hotel, including a HSBC terminal just on the next corner. Location was perhaps the best feature of the hotel. The rooms were relatively small and cramped. Because the desk was in a small alcove it was difficult to actually pull out the desk chair and use the desk. The closet space was also a bit smaller than normal. Nevertheless, the room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The shower was satisfactory even though a bit slippery when entering or leaving the ceramic tub. There is a restaurant/pub on the lower level called "The Pub" but strangely enough was closed early Saturday evening even though the hours posted indicated it should have been open. I did not use the restaurant service breakfast, preferring to have and espresso coffee at one of several places closeby. The staff were friendly and did make a couple of good recommendations for a restaurant when I checked in late. Checkout was easy and quite efficient. However, I am concerned about a possible double billing on my credit card but I expect that this will be resolved in a day or two without my intervention. It is just that the credit card website showed two separate (but different) charges to my account about 30 hours after I checked out. Don't expect picture perfect views from your window. My own room looked out at the side of another plain building next door. If I looked far to the right, I could see the Airport Express bus stop and the far side of the Fairmont Royal York Hotel. It was also somewhat noisy in my room even though I was on the top floor. Both traffic noise and especially the air conditioner made sound sleep a little difficult. To be fair, the hotel was priced lower than nearby hotels. My own room, at the convention rate was about CDN$171 per night including taxes.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ive eever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: spanmac
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel last july,I Loved it.the location was slap bang in the middle of toronto,a 5 minute walk to the harbour front,cn tower and the dome.I Have recommended this hotel to all my friends and one of them has been and loved it too,the staff were very friendly,that they got a memebr to go to a chemist at night to get me some sick tablets as i had bad jetlag,Deffinetly go to this hotel.Dont listen to the bad reviews.This hotel beats the rest!!

Reviews.Title: “Toronto an exciting city but a stuffy hotel”
Reviews.Author: quasargal
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona was our base for 3 nights in Toronto. The first room they showed us was a tiny double room with no space to hang our clothes up. We fortunately had booked a twin room which was a bit bigger with a good sized wardrobe. The room was clean and the bathroom and shower were good. However you could not see the sky no matter how hard you tried and the windows were covered in louvered shutters which made the room gloomy and claustrophobic. If there had been good lighting this would have dispelled the gloom but it was very subdued lighting which did not. It was a room for sleeping and washing in, not really comfortable. The air conditioning was draughty and the noise was like a jet engine when turned on and if you left it off you could hear all the other AC units in the well of walls that faced you on all sides. Take your own kettle as the coffee machine took hours to get lukewarm The hotel did a breakfast buffet but everything felt small poor quality and penny pinching. It was like a dolls house breakfast. They did not quickly refill used up items. However we tried to buy a cooked breakfast in the shopping mall opposite and I ended up with a MacDonaldâ€™s â€˜heartyâ€™ breakfast of folded square eggs !! that was salty and unappetising. If you could eat wheat Timmy Hortonâ€™s opposite the hotel was popular with others. Toronto is a great city and the open topped touring bus was a great way to get photos. The CN tower is magnificent and we had a meal in the 360 revolving restaurant that was excellent. I have never tasted steak like it. The views were stunning. We took a helicopter ride over Niagara Falls and also went on the Maid of the Mist. Enjoyed both very much. We visited Niagara on Lake and loved the little clapper board houses and the Main Street. Visited Ottawa but not impressed, mind you it was grey and raining which possible did not help. We went onto Montreal see my review of the Meridian Versailles Hotel. I have prepared a slide show of our week long trip which I can email in a few seconds if anyone is interested.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value”
Reviews.Author: Londoner16
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not cheap - almost 200 Canadian dollars (including tax and a buffet breakfast) per night for a standard room. We were shocked by the so-called "standard" room. It was tiny: to do some ironing on the ironing board, or to have access to the electric power points, one literally had to move the furniture around. Cupboard space was inadequate. The shower was lukewarm. The only redeeming featrure was the location: not in an attractive part of Toronto, but at least within walking distance of the CN Tower and the main railway station. I thought it was exceptionally bad value for money, and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - small but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Benaldo
Reviews.Content: We went at the end of May / early June 07 and it was perfect for our 4 night stay. We were having a city break in Toronto and looking to do all the sightseeing / shopping we could do. The Strathcona was perfect for this. We didn't spend a huge amount of time in the hotel but it was a perfect location. You are very close (within 10 min walk) of the CN Tower, Rogers Centre (Skydome), Union Station, Hop-on/off bus tour stop and another 5 minutes to the harbour front. There are lots of bars and restaurants within a short distance especially along King St West. The hotel staff seemed pleasant enough and we had new towels every day. The rooms were pretty modern too. I would also recommend making a trip to the Distillery District - lots of little shops and also the Mill Street Brewery has some excellent beers and food.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: uktravelller
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location downtown near to the attractions. The rooms are tiny no room to hang anything, we had a room which faced another part of the hotel and we could not tell what time of the day it was. The pub downstairs served nice food and the staff were friendly, more than i can say for the lady who checked us in, although the gentleman who checked us out was helpful. The York cafe not that great for breakfast, go across the road to Tim Hortons, for coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lyn2005
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night at the Strathcona, we have stayed there before. We find the location is great, lots of restaurants downtown, close to everything. This time our room was not on the street side, it faced another wing of the hotel which was quite close. The only way we could tell if the sun was shining or not was to look straight up. It also made the room quite dark. It seemed smaller than the room we had that faced the street. The room was fine and we were leaving in the morning so we didn't bother asking to be changed. I would suggest that you ask for a street-view room. However, you can't beat the price when you compare it to other hotels in the area. It's in a perfect location, has all the amenities that you need and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lousy hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: voyageuse24
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location Affordable Cons: Hotel staff (see below) While our stay started out well, it turned into a disaster by the end. We were situated across from about 2-4 rooms of American college students who were in Toronto to drink heavily, smoke and make as much noise as they possible could. Despite numerous calls to the front desk to remedy the problem, they did absolutely nothing to help. We had two sleepless nights & this put a major damper on what was otherwise a fantastic trip. My advice: Pay the extra money & stay somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ace1967
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought the Strathcona was a pleasant Hotel. The room we stayed in was on the small side but I would not say it was cramped. The Hotel is ideally located for exploring Toronto with all the main attractions within walking distance, CN Tower, Rogers Center etc.. The Railway station is just a few minutes walk away should you wish to explore further afield! If you are looking for an inexpensive hotel which is conveniently located the Strachcone should not let you down. Would also recommend Tim Horton's which is just over the road if you want a quick breakfast. It also serves up the best coffee I have ever had. You should also be aware that the Hotel implemented a new Internet policy during my stay and it is no longer free, this may have since changed, but I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: uk-red
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strathcona for 5 nights at the end of March/early April 2007 and found it to be an excellent little hotel in a great location for a great price. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are fairly small but as I was travelling on my own and only want to use the room to sleep, shower and change, the size of the room was not a problem. The room was clean, warm, everything worked and it had a nice, powerful shower. The location of the hotel is superb - all of the major attractions and the train station are within easy walking distance and the airport express bus stops just over the road. Reception staff and the concierge were very friendly and helpful. I went to the cafe once for an excellent breakfast and had a few beers and a bite to eat in the pub downstairs. Again, the staff were very friendly and the service was excellent. I would recommend going to the pub when the Maple Leafs are playing at home as you can enter a draw to win a jersey. All in all I can highly recommend this hotel, especially for single travellers. The small rooms may not be ideal for families, but if you're on your own or in a small group it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped”
Reviews.Author: tracker822
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night and we were pleased it was only one night. The rooms are really small and are cramped. We checked into a standard twin, which was booked for us as part of a tour. I rang reception to ask for a larger room. My partner is 6'4'' and his legs hung over the bed!. No room to move around either. We paid an extra $20 to upgrade to a better room, it had a double bed but space still seemed at a premium here. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen too but they moved us swiftly and with little fuss. I can only guess that they designed this hotel around fitting as much rooms in as possible. On the plus side, excellent location, breakfast was ok and the bar attached to the hotel was nice. The staff were good and very friendly. This hotel would be good for an overnight stay or if you want a budget hotel that you just intend to 'crash' in but I would not recommend for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dodgy window coverings!!”
Reviews.Author: betsywanderlust
Reviews.Content: Good Location, close to Union - Main Train Station. Room fine. Hotel has 2 computers to access internet in reception area which is handy, and are first come first serve. Room comfortable but we had a bit of trouble with heater so it was a bit draughty. But that may have been our fault. Room a bit noisy as traffic noise outside. Our room was facing the road, other rooms may be quieter but I dont know. The hairdryer in Bathroom, its plug connection looked a bit dodgy so I didn't go near it. It may have been ok but I didn't chance it. Good job hairdryers make my hair frizzy anyway!! Room did not have curtains but window shutters and I think curtains would have been better. They let in a bit of light and were not v insulating. I was worried overlooking properties maybe could look in as the shutters had little gaps. Reception mostly efficient. Sometimes if you had been queueing up they would then answer phone before seeing to you which I found a bit annoying. But they were otherwise friendly. Would I stay there again? Maybe if I worked out how to use the the heater! or it was In the summer so doesn't matter about heater, and if the room not facing the road. My partner was happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jnic999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this Hotel and found it to be above average for a budget hotel. I contacted them prior to travelling from Scotland asking for a non smoking quiet room and they provided both without any problem. A busy hotel but within walking distance of nearly everything you would want to visit on a short break. The Express coach from the Airport arrives almost outside the door of this hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: TuebingenTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Free internet and printing onsite, helpful concierge, clean, nicely-decorated rooms, and fantastic location for arriving by train or airport shuttle. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sally 21
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location,close to subway station, restaurants, coffee houses, c n tower,the rodgers centre and the eaton centre. the rooms may be a bit on the small side but you don't go to toronto to sit in your hotel room. the rooms were tastefully decorated and cleaned every day with fresh towels in the bathroom. the shower was hot and powerfull. complimenary toiletries and coffee were also placed in the rooms each day. a good buffet breakfast in the york street cafe in the lobby for $14, which was great. we didn't go to the hotel pub but the menu for that looked good too. this hotel is recommended and was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Strathcona”
Reviews.Author: DOUGB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Perfect location Price ok Walking distance to most of the main tourist attractions. Would stay here again. Saturday night was bit noisey but other nights were fine. Take the ferry over to theToronto Islands Lovelly walks and the views of the City skyline

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: canuckaussie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I was leaving from Union Station early in the morning. Only a short stroll to the station, CN Tower and the shops of Yonge street. It was much nicer than other bigger hotels I have previously stayed at in the area. The only thing I would have liked would be a refrigerator. But the bathroom was new, with iron, hairdryer, all the amenities. The one thing that stood out to me was the quality of the sheets. I have never felt any so nice before. I paid $109Ca, booking through Wotif. Fantastic price for the area, and the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “grat hotel at a bargain price near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: trinity-tiger
Reviews.Content: june 29 to july 4 2005 i attended a very large (more than 50000 people) convention - the hotel was perfect - it was just a couple of blocks away from the convention center - it was a steal of a deal at canadian $150 per night - it was booked through the convention organizers and i felt very lucky to get such a great location at such a good price - other downtown hotels were considerably more - we had some events at the royal york across the street so it was very handy for that also - the rooms are clean but nothing fancy - the restaurant down stairs has a good breakfast buffet my only complaint was that when i had asked for the tax refund form at the end of my stay, they asked me for my credit card again and tried to file it through a service (for a fee of course) - they were able to cancel it though - (if you mail it in to canada revenue, they will mail you a check in foreign currency which you can cash at your local bank) if i visit toronto again, i will stay here since it is close to downtown and the attractions i am from san antonio, texas

Reviews.Title: “Small, but close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Avonchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY close to the Air Canada Centre, and the Rogers Centre, which was perfect for our needs. We only stayed one night. The room was quite small and a bit shabby, but clean. One word of warning, we had room 310, which is a smoking room. It was right next to the vending machine and ice machine room. All night long, I could hear people going in and out to get ice and pop. I could also hear the ice machine making ice and dropping it into the bin. If they try to give you room 310, just say no, unless you are a heavy sleeper. The room had no view, but we were only there to sleep. It was only a five minute walk to the Air Canada Centre, which was perfect. DO NOT park in the underground garage next to the hotel. The hotel has no parking, but if you go around the corner, the lots are cheaper. We paid $28.50 for 18 hours of parking, which I find to be ridiculous! It was $15 for 24 hours, just around the corner. All in all a great place to stay for concerts of sporting events.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: MelissaB
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona is well located - well, as good as you can get in Toronto, where everything seems a long way away from wherever you are! It's really close to the CN tower and the Rogers Centre, and handy for evening entertainment, theatres etc. We managed to walk everywhere in Toronto from the hotel - we only used the metro once. The room we had (on the 12th floor, facing the street) was very small, and decorated in a rather dated way. Perhaps those people who mentioned minimalist decor had been in recently refubished rooms? The other thing we noticed was the rather strange absence of double glazing - which meant road noise from early to late. If we were to return, I'd ask to see whether there are any refurbished rooms, and rooms with double glazing (or maybe a room that doesn't face the street). Having said that, as another reviewer mentioned, we weren't in the room all that much - so bearing in mind the price and location, I'd return again - even to the same room. By the way - the buffet breakfasts are (in my opinion) good value ... you can eat as much as you want for a fixed price, which in our case meant that we often didn't need lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: yazzy13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Strathcona for one night on a weekend. It is in a fantastic location in downtown Toronto. The room was small but nicely, if minimally, decorated â€“ ideal for a short overnight stay. Check-in was easy. At check out time, I worried that it might take long given the number of people who were waiting; however, it was very efficient. Downsides? There is no parking on site. However, a couple of blocks away there is a lot that the hotel recommends, and parking there was easy and inexpensive (on the weekend). There was no view from the room, and the air conditioning unit was very noisy. Those negatives could not outweigh the value and location for this hotel. We would stay again if looking for a great location where all you really need is a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on May 18, 2006 for a concert, just for one night. It was VERY small, but it is in a great location and within walking distance to many attractions, but DO wear comfortable shoes!! If you are going for ambience, this is not the place. If you just want somewhere to lay your head then this will do nicely. The Tim Horton's across the street is perfect if you are on a budget. The concierge does not know much, or, if he does, he does not verbalize it. We asked for directions and he simply drew on a map, no words whatsoever. Oh well!! The bathrooms are not well ventilated and have very low ceilings. You need to wait 30 minutes to apply makeup in the mirror or do it in the room. But, for a cheap night in Toronto, it is worth a go.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Zabka
Reviews.Content: We had pleasant stay at this hotel. Yes â€“ the rooms are small but they are clean. Before our arrival I sent an email to the hotel asking for non smoking room. I got a reply within few hours confirming my request. The staff were very helpful. There was no safe in the room but you can put your valuables to the safety boxes in reception. The location is very good. Very close to Union Station. The rooms and bathrooms might need a little updating (we had cracked sink in the bathroomâ€¦) but if I was going to Toronto again I would stay at this hotel. The location is perfect and if you use the hotel just for sleeping â€“ thatâ€™s the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a great bargain!”
Reviews.Author: SRWCardiff_UK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the back of the reviews on this website and we weren't disappointed. Ditto everything stated in previous (good) reviews- you can't beat the location- even for the airport express bus which drops off and picks up straight opposite the hotel. Although on the way back to the airport the hotel booked us a cab with a company they have an arrangement for $45. It was also ideal for us as we were picking up a hire car at Union Station- literally 3 minutes walk. The rooms weren't the biggest, but very clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. A definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell them how good the location is”
Reviews.Author: gnarcheese
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the doorstep of Union station, the financial district, CN tower and a host of other attractions. The size of rooms could be a drawback to some (they aren't much bigger than your average British living room), but they are clean and functional. The hotel is well situated for tourists or even just visitors to Toronto looking for a good night out. There is a Tim Horton's coffee house across the street that serves hot food until 3am, and coffee 24/7, plus a newsagent. Union is the nearest TTC subway stop, right at the heart of the network. Those after more style and larger rooms should consider the Fairmont Royal York, just across the street on Front St. W. All in all a very good hotel for travellers on a budget without their own transport.

Reviews.Title: “A real eye opener!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter24
Reviews.Content: It was our second time going to Toronto- When we went to book it there was only smoking rooms left. Our room was very small and at the back of the hotel. The room smelt of stale smoke for the whole 7 days also the wallpaper had yellow smoke stains on it. When we opened a window there was an air vent right beside us so it was too noisey. However the location of the hotel was perfect for getting around the city. The staff were nice and there was always someone on recpetion.

Reviews.Title: “Sports Fans-Location,Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best kept secret for the tourist that wants to be downtown, without paying 159.00 per night. Suprised to see that we were across the street from the Royal York..only blocks away from the AC Centre,Skydome, CN Tower,Wayne Gretzkys,theater district,Hockey Hall of Fame, and the Young Street shopping...get the picture. For 85.00 per night,it is easy to overlook the small rooms.Everything looks newly renovated, certainly very clean. Great breakfast, and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “One for the 'yes' pile”
Reviews.Author: onebigshop
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Toronto and had booked the hotel blind, so we didn't know what to expect. The hotel is perfectly situated, it is exactly where most tourists will need to be, go out the doors turn left for shopping, turn right for the CN Tower. It's no more than 5 -10 minutes from everything important. The room itself was quite small, but it was clean and well presented, same goes for the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the TV was huge. The size of the room was not an issue, after all most of the time all you use it for is sleep - how much room do you need for that - although there was a desk and chair, should you wish to start writing some postacrds! The temperature of the room was perfect and controllable. The general upkeep of the hotel was very good and the staff were excellent. There is a breakfast room in the hotel, although we didn't use it. It looked as though the people who had breakfast were happy. We would not hesitate to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: deekaye
Reviews.Content: The Strathcona proved to be a pleasant surprise for a low priced hotel in downtown Toronto: in addition to a good location, it had courteous staff, very clean and pleasant facilities, and (at least for a slight upgrade from "standard") a fairly large room.

Reviews.Title: “Where the sun never shines”
Reviews.Author: Graham2109
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at this hotel for two nights. If you don't mind sleeping in a "shoe box" with a view that can be bettered in most prisons, this is the hotel for you! In fact, the window was so close to the opposite wall, it was impossible to tell whether it was day or night, rain or shine! However, the location is great, very close to the Union Station and the business district, so if you are just coming back to the hotel to sleep, it is manageable. Two redeeming features were the breakfasts, which were excellent, and the special deal for using the next door Wellington Fitness Club, which has great facilities. I found the reception staff pretty surly and unhelpful, and the "non-smoking" room I was given smelt of smoke. They did however have a machine to help clear the fumes! One other "moan" - the lifts were inadequate to cope with the number of guests - a ten minute wait seemed pretty standard! Not a great hotel, but OK for business travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “its true”
Reviews.Author: TorontoIcecream
Reviews.Content: Finding the hotel is kinda tricky. Parking is about a 10 mintue walk and sucks if you have lots of luggage to carry. The rooms are small but cozy however some issues did araise such as coffee machine not working, missing remote control, the smell of mildew in the middle of the night and the loud downtown noises which makes it hard to sleep. The customer service in the hotel did the best they could by bringing hot fresh coffee from room service as well as free breakfest buffet. I would recommend this hotel if you were cabbing it and planning to stay up late.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the action. Walk to Rogers Stadium, Air Canada Arena, CN Tower, Convention Center. Rooms are small but if you are just going to sleep there it will be certanly enough. They have some nice features found on some high priced hotels (in room coffee, in room movies, hair dryer, Ironing Table). I got breakfast included and it is very good also. It seems very clean and staff is friendly. Only minus: noise in the street, but nothing you don't hear in your own home. It is incredible you find such a bargain hotel in downtown in any city in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good $$$”
Reviews.Author: saggar1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here over the labour day weekend and i can tell you the location is phenomenal! You can just park your car and walk to any of the major attractions within 5-10min. Rooms were a bit small but very clean, but for $110/nite in downtown can't expect better. Staff was ok and the area gets a bit quiet after dark. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Small rooms, in great location”
Reviews.Author: professorjackson
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is its best attribute. I was in Toronto for an Argos football game August 12 and stayed at the Strathcona (for the second time). I paid $83USD for a Friday night. This is cheap by downtown T.O. standards. The room was small and clean with no view at all, but I did not care because I was noe in town for the view or the size of the room. Parking is two blocks down Wellington St. and cost $15CDN for a night -- again not bad by T.O. standards. Overall a perefectly serviceable hotel if you are looking for a clean room in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutley loved our stay at the Strathcona Hotel. It was in the middle of it all, the location is great. The hotel was very neat and clean, great atmosphere. The room was small but very elegant. The staff was very helpful no matter what our needs were. We would definetly recommend the Strathcona Hotel to all our friends and family to stay at this great place.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Union Station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK, having read the rest of the reviews on this page you've probably already worked out what's great and what's awful about the Strathcona. We picked it for one night because were getting a train early the next morning, and wanted somewhere within easy walking distance of Union Station - the station entrance is about 2 minutes walk away from the hotel. Apart from the location, the other main plus is the price; also, our room was, if basic, perfectly clean and reasonably nicely presented. On the downside, I'd have to agree with the criticisms already flagged up by others. The desk staff were not particularly friendly and certainly lacking in the kind of effortless polish you'd normally expect. I had no help with luggage, even when one bag burst open. Our room was tiny, without air-conditioning or any kind of a view. But all in all, we got what we wanted - a decent night's sleep and an easy start the next morning. One night was probably enough here, but if all you want is somewhere to crash, it's a very reasonable bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strathcona for my first trip to Toronto. I picked it because the location is so incredibly central, and considering it is downtown, the price was very reasonable. All things considered, this was a good choice. The room was very small, in fact it most likely once was a chambermaid's closet. Granted I took the cheapest room available. I was on my own and don't really care about the room as long as I have a place to leave my stuff, sleep comfortably and clean up. So no real complaints there. The location is incredible. 5-10 minute walk to anywhere I wanted to go. CN Tower, Theatre/night club district, Hockey Hall of Fame, spectacular harbour area. Even the Eaton Center and heart of Yonge street aren't that far away. Subway at Union station is practically across the street if I ventured further. Some tips: Airport shuttle bus drops off across the street. Tim Horton's is also across the street - a perfect place for a cheap and inexpensive breakfast to start your day. The reason I only give this place 2 out of 5 stars is the service was horrible. The gentleman who checked me could not have been any less interested in his job. It was a terrible first impression of the place. I thought maybe he was having a bad day, but the next night he was exactly the same. Other counter staff seemed friendlier, but I always got stuck with that guy. Cleaning staff wasn't great either. Fresh towels were always supplied, but bed was never made, soaps and shampoos never restocked. Personally I don't really care about that, but it's sort of expected for $120 a night I was spending. Lastly the concierge desk was a joke. Completely unknowledgeable. I wasn't asking for anything grand, just for some directions and inquiring about theatre tickets. Gentleman there didn't have any idea, but that's fine, I figured it out on my own. Bottom line, this place doesn't get the greatest review because of service. The room was really small too. While the location was phenomenal, now that I know the city better, I will stay further away from the downtown core but at a hotel close to the subway. In 5 minutes I can ride a subway right down to Union station, and the hotel will probably have a bigger room, be slightly cheaper, and almost assuredly have friendlier check in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Strathcona”
Reviews.Author: rickwal
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from the Strathcona Hotel, did not know what to expect after reading some of the reviews on here but was pleasantly surprised. Arrived at the hotel after a long flight to a smiling, cheerful receptionist who checked us in, as in other posts, the rooms are small but we did not come to Toronto to stay in the room! Our room looks as though it has recently been refurbishedm was extemely clean and considering the size extemely comfortable. We ate breakfast twice which was nice but we ate out as well (Tim Hortons is right across the road and is ideal for Coffee and a bagel). There is a pub in the basement which is used by guests and regulars, the staff are very friendly and will give you information on the city and tips on where to go. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and when I return to Toronto will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Light is extra, don't you know?!”
Reviews.Author: jkn2004
Reviews.Content: Don't expect light, space or windows that look out onto ANYTHING (even the other side of the street would have been nice) at the Strathcona. Its in a good location (albeit over the road from the best hotel in town which makes you feel even worse that you booked yourself into this poopey hotel), but the lack of insulation means that you can practically hear people sneezing on the street below, and you hear EVERYTHING from the room next door and the hallway. The room is sooo teeny that I don't think it could ever be described as handicapped accessible (well, you might be able to get in the door in a wheelchair, but don't expect to be able to get round to the loo, let alone get into the cupboard, sorry, bathroom.) If you were staying only 1 night i guess you could put up with it (although despite the natural-light-challenged nature of the rooms there's useless artificial lighting in the room) so it is literally a place to crash ONLY. Tried to complain to the front desk staff and the manager, but they were most unhelpful, and said that we could only swap to a better room (with actual light- woo hoo!) for the last 2 nights of our stay. Sadly, that still leaves 5 nights in a dark closet. My advice- splash out a few extra dollars (its not much more) and stay in a real hotel! If you are staying room only here and want breakfast in their cafe it is practically the same price as the cafe in the Fairmont Royal York!!!! Go on....treat yourself elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and had got a cheap deal on flights to toronto. I had looked at lots of different accommodation and got a good price for this hotel. I didnt expect much but was really suprised when we arrived. Our room was small but done us for all the time we spent in it. It was clean and modern and staff were friendly. Ask for a street view- our rooom was quite dark as we were at the back of the building. With a bar and resturaunt in it and a TIM HORTONS across the road what more could you want. I have sent people from i come home and would def recommend it to you!!

Reviews.Title: “hmph”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights in Toronto for a convention. Good news, The Strathcona is relatively close to the convention center and downtown. Maybe a block from subway and Path (the Toronto underground) entrance. Clean rooms, nice looking, newly 'remodeled' bathrooms, room service, laundry service, etc. Bad news: overpriced, reservations screwed up (two double queen rooms became two rooms with a full-sized bed each. Barely had space for a cot in each), and the staff were less than helpful. Small, small, small. Parking was a suggested lot two blocks away. The 'remodeled' bathroom was practically brand new. So new in fact, there was no toilet paper holder. One shelf over the toilet tank, single bowl sink, you run out of space in a hurry. Did I mention it was small? Then there was a distinct lack of water pressure. Perhaps this was from being on the 11th floor, so that might improve down lower. Oh, but don't count on a view. In a good room, you'd be able to see a different building. In ours, we got the half alley view of the other rooms in the hotel. This might be alright for a single traveller, on an expense account, who had no problems requiring staff assistance. That might be generous, too. Short form: 2 star service in a 3 star hotel charging 4 star prices trying to compete with a 5 star neighborhood. Try to find a bargain in the Royal York instead; it's right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small, but not bad. The location is great. The staff could care less if you are having a problem. Don't use the website for booking, because it doesn't mean anything when you check in. If you book a room with two double beds, expect 2 army cots, and a less than friendly front desk employee to blame the mix-up on the website. The heat, tv, phone, and elevator were not working on our stay. The night before the power was off. Drawing this to the attention of the staff at the front desk did not do much good....THEY DON'T CARE!!! It seemed this was a usual occurence. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, there isn't a person I hate that much.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lousy stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online. On arrival the lobby looks nice and it seems like a nice place and judging by the images on the web the rooms looked modern and big. We initially had a standard room that was no bigger than a boxroom and a window that looked out onto an air duct, after complaining we were upgraded (at a cost) to a larger room that seemed fine - after all we were only sleeping there. The room although larger was very cold and the heating system is old and is a blow heater, therefore very noisy and not very warm. After one very restless and cold night I became really sick and I ended the last part of my trip wanting to come back to the UK. We did get some money back after complaining ot the manager however I would not recommend staying at the Strathcona, its a fab location for the CN Tower and Sky Dome but if you don't want to come home sick then I advise you to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the room we stayed in was small, it had everything we needed for a 2 night stay. Ideal for us as very close to the union train station ( which we needed to get to). Actually quieter than the Hilton which woke us at 12.30 after midnight with a false fire alarm ( and we were not allowed to leave our floor! ). Yummy Tim Hortons across the road and a fantastic Italian restaurant around the corner. Great breakfast in the restaurant, with excellent service. Overall excellent service from all staff and they were very helpful!! Recommended if you want a reasonably priced hotel in a handy location. Some noise from outside but certainly not enough to keep me awake plus it IS in the heart of downtown Toronto! Overall a pleasant place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Saucebrick
Reviews.Content: Strathcona hotel, Toronto. Like a lot of people we read your reviews about the hotel before we booked it (we were staying for three nights). We were a little apprehensive about some of the negative feedback regarding noise etc. However, we found the hotel warm and cosy and excellent value for money. The whole place was very clean and maintained to a high standard. Our room, on the 11th floor, was smallish, not tiny, but suited us (two adults). It was equipped with a colour TV that had about 15 channels, a radio alarm clock, coffee maker (this is a coffee maker only, not an electric kettle), hair dryer, iron and ironing board, a nice comfy double bed with plenty of covers and pillows, lots of storage drawers and a decent sized built in closet. There was an en-suit modern bathroom fitted with both a bath and shower. The room was cleaned daily and supplied with clean towels and replacement coffee and milk sachets. The room was a bit dark, but not overly so, and the view out of the window was of the next door office block, but this didnâ€™t bother us as we were only using the hotel as a base, and anyway we were out all day sightseeing. As regards the noise, we werenâ€™t bothered by any, even though I was â€˜waitingâ€™ for it after reading the other reviews. The only noise was the usual background sounds you hear anywhere. There is an on-site restaurant that we didnâ€™t use, and a pub that also served meals and we found very pleasant. There is a travel consultant located in the reception area and all the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel offers safe deposit boxes at no extra charge and luggage storage facilities which we found very useful as our flight was much later than the check out time, so we could store our cases and do a last bit of sightseeing. The location is first class, close to all the usual tourist haunts and transport stops. We found this hotel excellent value for money considering the location and amenities and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rrankin
Reviews.Content: I've just completed a month long vacation in Canada, including a week stay at the Stratcona Hotel early December. Staying off-season I got a good deal on the price considering the overall quality and location. Travelling from the airport was easy, the airport shuttle bus stops at the Royal York just around the corner The hotel room was clean and well presented. The staff, both front of house and the maid were always polite and friendly. The only problem I had was with the TV volume button which was fixed immediately. The location is great for downtown Toronto. Near everything you want and easy access to the underground PATH network and transport system. As well as the Tim Hortons (coffee, soups, sandwiches etc..) there is the Toronto Dominion Centre food hall just across the street as well, which is handy for breakfast or lunch. My only criticism is that the wardrobe is laughably small which could be a problem if you are on a business trip and need to hang a lot of clothes. In summary this hotel was generally good, and for the price excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews before travelling at beginning of Dec 2004. Our room was situated on 12th Floor. No problems with regards to noise from other rooms, even though I had packed the ear plugs! The room itself was big enough, very clean and made up every day with fresh towels - excellent. Location was superb. Very close to CN Tower and Skydome. Few blocks from Eaton Centre. Tim Hortons just across the road - open 24 hours! Recommend Baton Rouge on Yonge Street to eat. Steaks were extremely tasty! Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected regarding noise”
Reviews.Author: edinburgher2
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of this hotel before booking our 6 night stay (Sept 26th to Oct 2nd 04). We e-mailed prior to arrival and requested as quiet a room as possible. Whether or not the room we were allocated (314) was a quieter room or we were just lucky with the guests above, below and near to us, we do not know, but we did not find it noisy and did not need the earplugs we had taken with us!! That said, the online reviews we had read were spot on. The room was indeed pretty dark, and not big. We likened it to an inside cabin on a cruise ship. That did not matter to us. Our only grumble was that the (very narrow) hanging space was mostly taken up with an iron and board. We had only 4 hangers between 2 of us. There was no room for more than that. The location was indeed excellent. A 5 minute walk to either St Andrew or Union subway, 5 mins also to Union station trains, and the same for the trams on King St. 15 minutes walk to the waterfront and the ferries to the islands, the same to the Eaton Centre. There is a Tim Hortons just steps from the hotel (directly across the street) and the airport shuttle bus stops there also. (its the side entrance to the Fairmount Royal Hotel) We found Shopsys (diner) excellent for breakfast and close to St Lawrence district, supermarket etc. Its on a corner 5-7 mins walk away just past the Hockey Hall of Fame. Hortons was fine for a simpler breakfast. The hotel breakfast is quite expensive in comparison. There is a huge Marche Movenpick between the hotel and the Hockey Hall of Fame and a smaller one in the opposite direction close to the CN Tower. The price for the location is good value. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vernperry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Strathcona while attending the Toronto Film Festival this past weekend. If there are only two in your party, this is a very cozy hotel. Our room was very comfortable and the location was great. You are one block away from the train terminal and the Airport Express shuttle picks you up right across the street. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for late risers!”
Reviews.Author: WilmslowTravelMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on two separate occasions and my verdict is this: Advantages: central - great for CN Tower, Skydome, Path, harbour, etc. Disadvantages: Every day people would be up at 7am banging doors, pipes rumbling from showers and Air Con, traffic outside buzzing. Conclusion: If you've paid over the odds for this place, cancel and book elsewhere, especially if you like a lie in. I paid about Â£40 a night! Also, ask for a room VERY high up! Personally I'd stay at the Royal York next time.

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is excellent for all attractions but the room we got had no sound proofing at all. We were woken up at all hours of the night by noises from other rooms and even with the shutters open there was no daylight in the room. We were also woken at 7.30 am on a Sunday morning by a fire alarm which turned out to be nothing. We had to quiz the firemen to see if it was safe to go back in as the staff were nowhere to be seen. However the room was kept very clean and the staff were all very polite and helpful so maybe we were just unlucky. We were there at the beginning of June 2004. We appreciate that compared to other downtown hotels the Strathcona is well priced but it doesn't help if you can't get a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Toronto base”
Reviews.Author: hal9341
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strathcona for a week at the beginning of June 2004. Overall we were pleased with our stay. Staff are very pleasant, lobby nice and the York Street Cafe, where breakfast is taken is very good too. As others have said the location is excellent. Close to all tourist attractions, shopping and the theatre district. The airport express leaves from accross the road, so is good to save a few dollars. There were two things that we didn't like and wish the hotel would address. Firstly the the design of the building means the windows are very small. To compensate for this we would have liked extra lighting in the room. This would give the room a lighter, airier, and by turn BIGGER feel. The other gripe is the amount of clothes hanging space. No wardrobe to speak of at all. If you have lots of fancy clothes you want/need to hang then stay somewhere else. I felt the the sitting bench was not really necessary in the room and would have preferred that space to have an extendable rail or something. Anyway, if you want a good, cheap (but not grotty) base in Toronto this hotel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “They saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: sandlesandsunglasses
Reviews.Content: We were only supposed to stay at the Strathcona for one night (we had hockey tickets - go leafs go!) and then we had planned to move to a bed and breakfast that wasn't so close to downtown. We arrived and check in with our internet fare and went to check out the hockey events happening downtown, it was a blast! There was a shuttle that dropped us right at the hotel from the airport (it is across from the Royal York) and the staff were so friendly. They even looked up our B and B on the internet, got us show information and printed maps for us. The next day we were sad to leave but hailed a cab and went to the B and B - What a dump!!!!! It was so awful!!!! We called our friends at the Strathcona and they felt really bad for us and not only gave us the cheaper rate we had recieved on the internet but also upgraded our room. (Can you imagine? they were so excellent!!!) The bottom line - this is the place to stay - 1. It is close to EVERYTHING (everything you want to see is just around the corner, we walked everywhere except Niagra Falls - but the train station to go there is less than a 2 minute walk!) 2. There is a Tim Hortons across the street and the best pub ever in the basement level (it is actually called The Pub I think) 3. It is beautiful and newly renovated and clean and nicely decorated. 4. The staff were WONDERFUL!!! They were helpful in every way from accomodating us when our other reservations fell through to helping us find show tickets to giving us directions. Wow! 5. Did I mention how convenient the location is and how reasonable the rates were? You have to stay here! The only drawback I can think of is that the room was a bit small, but we were never there anyway - only to sleep. I highly reccomend the Strathcona!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a package trip to Toronto and I must say I can't really fault it at all. The best thing though has to be the location. It is no more than 10 minutes walk from any of the main attractions. CN tower, skydome, Air Canada centre, Eaton Place, HarbourFront etc. The airport shuttle bus even stops just accross the road. We only had a standard room and it was on the small side but it was clean and tidy and we didn't spend that much time in it anyway. The breakfast/lunch cafe attached is excellant and the pub/sports bar underneath is also good but as we didn't actually eat there I can't comment on the food. However you are spoilt for choice for good cheap eating places in Toronto. If I was going to Toronto again or if I knew of anyone going I would recommend the Strathcona as a base for the trip. One thing to be aware of though is that their are roadworks going on just down the road from the hotel which can get noisy but no nosier than loud traffic and isn't all day this doesn't just affect this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 1 night at this hotel. We were going to a concert and found the location to the Air Canada Center extemely close-5 min walk. It is also just a few mins walk to the Union Subway station. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There is no parking available at the hotel itself, however, the staff recommends a more reasonable lot around the corner. It is a short 2 blocks from the hotel, about a 5 min walk. ($13 for 24 hours) Or you could always park directly next door in the ramp, which we were advised is much more expensive. We had the larger room, 2 queen beds, which I think is about the size of a regular hotel room. The room was clean!! The only bad thing I can say was the towels had a funky smell. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff/Lousy Room (initially prior to upgrade)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got the Strathcona through the Priceline website and was assigned Room 210. This room was small, actually very small (borderline puny), the bed was poor quality and also small (a double rather than a queen or king), there was absolutely no view (this wasnt a big priority for me personally), parking was two long city blocks away (no valet, no on-site self park. This was nothing even close to what Priceline lists as three star comparable such as Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott, Embassy Suites, or Sheraton. The door was not snug against the floor and I could hear conversations in the room across the hall without straining to listen, there was writing on the wall of the room, there was minimal table, counter, vanity, and dresser space. The staff was helpful and the location were good. But this is a 2 and 1/2 star hotel AT BEST. I hope it is not the policy of Priceline to let 3 Star Hotels assign inferior rooms to Priceline users. That's not what their commercial says.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price and Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable price. The location is excellent. Less than a minute walk to the subway, and short walk to many attractions. The front desk staff is extremely helpful and knowlegable. The Pub which is located in the basement is a great place to watch a game and grab a beer. The room's are clean. There is not a lot of space in them however if you are traveling on business it is sufficent. I will definately stay there again on my next trip to toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This recently renovated, very centrally located hotel was a great deal, considering how expensive hotels can be in downtown Toronto. I had a room with my teenage daughter and her friend for a week - the room was a decent size and the beds were surprisingly comfortable (I usually hate hotel beds). I would definitely stay there agin, providing the rates stay reasonable.

HotelInfo.Name: The Strathcona Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 60 York St. | At Wellington St., Toronto, Ontario M5J 1S8, Canada
